analyzed: dpal mkha' 'gro rgya mtsho rnal 'byor ma'i rgyud kyi rgyal po chen po'i 'grel pa gru gzings las dum skyes ma bskyed pa dang mtshan nyid dang 'khor lo bzhi'i rtsi'i rnam par gzhag pa dang sngags dgod pa dang dkyil 'khor gyi sgrub thabs dang de kho na nyid
translated: The commentary on the great king of yoginƒ´ tantras, the glorious Ocean of Dakinis, called the Ship, has explained the creation of Vajra Speech, the characteristics, the arrangement of the channels of the four cakras, the layout of the mantras, the means of accomplishing the ma·πá·∏çala, and the reality of the ma·πá·∏çala.

original: kyi rigs pas dam tshig bstan pa dang de ltar rnam pa lnga rnams kyi rnam par gzhag pa'i mtshan nyid kyi sna tshogs pa'i rgyas par bstan pa dang mdor bstan pa'i bshad pa ste le'u lnga pa'o /

analyzed: // / sems can don du sgyu ma gang //

analyzed: lha rdzas kyi ni phyag rgya'i rgyur //

original: sbyor ba sna tshogs bshad par bya //
analyzed: sbyor ba sna tshogs bshad par bya //

original: khrag 'thung gnyis med bdag nyid gzugs //
analyzed: khrag 'thung gnyis med bdag nyid gzugs //

original: kun rdzob kyi ni rnam par ston //
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi ni rnam par ston //

original: gdams ngag sna tshogs mtshan nyid can //
analyzed: gdams ngag sna tshogs mtshan nyid can //

original: 'grel pa yang dag bri bar bya //
analyzed: 'grel pa yang dag bri bar bya //

analyzed: da ni le'u drug pa rgya che bar bshad par bya ste //

analyzed: de nas gzhan pa mchog ces bya ba la sogs pas te de nas zhes bya ba ni sngon bzhin no //

analyzed: gzhan pa mchog ces bya ba ni 'chad par 'gyur ba'i le'u yongs su rdzogs pa'i bar gyi gzhung gi tshogs de bshad par bya ba'o //

analyzed: mdor bsdus pa ste rgyas par min //

original: dpal he ru ka zhes bya ba ni chos dang longs spyod rdzogs pa dang sprul pa dang bde ba chen po'i mtshan nyid thabs chen po de'i kun du sbyor ba las gzugs can ma'i mtshan nyid dge ba ste /

original: de de bzhin du bshad do //
analyzed: de de bzhin du bshad do //

original: lus can zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: lus can zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /

analyzed: las dang tshigs mtshams zhes bya ba ni las ni n'i'i yi ge'o //

original: tshigs mtshams zhes bya ba ni pi'i yi ge'o //
analyzed: tshigs mtshams zhes bya ba ni pi'i yi ge'o //

analyzed: rtsa'i yi ges bde ba'i dbang po'i gnas su r'u'i yi ge ste / 'dod chags chen @110a * //

analyzed: de'i phyir phyi rol la sogs pa mdor na bde ba la gnas par 'gro'o //

analyzed: de'i phyi rol gyi gzugs rang gis rang ni bdag nyid la lta ba ste de nyid skyed par byed do //

analyzed: nang gi bdag nyid kyi gzugs dbye ba med pa nyid kyi phyir blta'o zhes bya ba'i don to //

analyzed: de ltar des na tshigs mtshams kyi mdor bstan pa'i rgyas par bshad pa gsungs pa /

translated: The ‚Äúma·πá·∏çalas‚Äù are the five ma·πá·∏çalas, which are the channels that carry the menstrual blood that falls from the left and right, respectively. In the twelve [two-hour] periods of the lunar mansions such as Aries, there are three hundred and sixty ma·πá·∏çalas.

original: mo rnams so //
analyzed: mo rnams so //

original: 'dod pa ni bzhed ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa ni bzhed ces bya ba'o //

analyzed: g-yon zhes bya ba ni mtshan mo'i dus su mi phyed ma dang phra gzugs ma dang lha rdzas ma dang g-yon pa mo dang g-yon gzhol ma dang rus sbal skyes ma dang dngos po ma dang dbang bskur ma dang skyon bral ma dang non ma dang ma mo
translated: ‚ÄúLeft‚Äù means that during the night, the channels of life-force flow, namely, the non-dual, subtle form, divine, left-side, left-directed, tortoise-born, entity, consecration, faultless, heavy, mother,

analyzed: dang yid bzang ma dang brkyang ma mchog ces bya ba ste /

original: srog 'bab ma rnams so //
analyzed: srog 'bab ma rnams so //

analyzed: de bzhin du g-yas par ro ma la sogs pa nyin par 'bab ma rnams te /
translated: Similarly, during the day, the channels of the rasanƒÅ and so on flow in the right.

analyzed: de ltar lug la sogs pa r'a s'i bcu gnyis rnams kyis nyis ldab tu gnas pa'o //
translated: Thus, the twelve beginning with the sheep are located in pairs.

original: lhag ma zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: lhag ma zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The remaining ones are

original: dbus ma dang glu len ma dang gtum mo dang bdud 'joms ma ste bzhi po de bzhin du'o //
analyzed: dbus ma dang glu len ma dang gtum mo dang bdud 'joms ma ste bzhi po de bzhin du'o //
translated: the four: the central one, the singer, the fierce one, and the demon-conqueror.üîΩThese are the four channel-petals in the intermediate directions.

original: 'di rnams kyang mtshams kyi rtsa bzhi rnams te de rnams gru gsum nyid ces bya ba ni mtshams gcig mi snang ba byas pas gru gsum zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'di rnams kyang mtshams kyi rtsa bzhi rnams te de rnams gru gsum nyid ces bya ba ni mtshams gcig mi snang ba byas pas gru gsum zhes bya ba'i don to //

analyzed: @110b de nyid 'gyur rtsa sum cu rnams kyi chu tshod rtsa drug cu'i ste nyin gcig gi chu tshod do //

analyzed: slar yang de ltar rtsa dang chu tshod mtshams drug cur gnas te lte ba'i gnas su'o //

analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rkang pa dang lag pa la sogs pa 'di rnams kyi tshigs bcu gnyis po re re la rtsa sum cu rnams so //

analyzed: de rnams re re la yang mtshams lnga'i rtsa rnams te /

original: nyi ma'i rgyu bar gang 'gro ba //
analyzed: nyi ma'i rgyu bar gang 'gro ba //

original: zhes bya ba ni phyi rol du nyi ma'i nang du srog gis bgrod pa'i 'gro ba ste rtsa ba'i rtsar 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni phyi rol du nyi ma'i nang du srog gis bgrod pa'i 'gro ba ste rtsa ba'i rtsar 'jug pa'o //
translated: is the movement of the life-force in the external sun, which is the entry into the channel of the channels.

original: de ltar sum cu po re re la drug drug tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar sum cu po re re la drug drug tu 'gyur ro //

original: thams cad gcig tu byas pas brgya brgyad cur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thams cad gcig tu byas pas brgya brgyad cur 'gyur ro //

original: gang nyi ma rgyu bas de srog gi rnal 'byor ma rnams kyi bgrod pa ste lam dam par 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: gang nyi ma rgyu bas de srog gi rnal 'byor ma rnams kyi bgrod pa ste lam dam par 'jug pa'o //
translated: That which is the movement of the sun is the path of the yoginƒ´s of the life-force, which is the entry into the true path.

original: de ltar zla ba dang zla bar zhes bya ba ni 'pho bos so rnams kyi cha shas 'phel bas ye shes kyi dbang phyug ma rnams kyi rang bzhin gsal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar zla ba dang zla bar zhes bya ba ni 'pho bos so rnams kyi cha shas 'phel bas ye shes kyi dbang phyug ma rnams kyi rang bzhin gsal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, in each month and half month, the increase of the parts of the moon and sun, respectively, clarify the nature of the yoginƒ´s of the gnosis.

original: thams cad gnyis su med par 'gyur te 'di ni lte ba'i 'khor lo'o //
analyzed: thams cad gnyis su med par 'gyur te 'di ni lte ba'i 'khor lo'o //
translated: All of them become nondual, which is the navel cakra.

original: de bzhin du snying gar bshad pa zhes bya ba ni snying ga'i 'khor lo'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du snying gar bshad pa zhes bya ba ni snying ga'i 'khor lo'o //
translated: Similarly, ‚Äúexplained at the heart‚Äù is the heart cakra.

original: mgrin par zhes bya ba ni mgrin pa'i 'khor lo ste gang lta bu'i khams zhes bya ba ni me'i khams so //
analyzed: mgrin par zhes bya ba ni mgrin pa'i 'khor lo ste gang lta bu'i khams zhes bya ba ni me'i khams so //
translated: ‚ÄúIn the throat‚Äù means in the throat cakra. ‚ÄúWhat kind of element?‚Äù means the fire element.

original: sum cu gnyis zhes bya ba ni mog bo'i 'khor lo'o //
analyzed: sum cu gnyis zhes bya ba ni mog bo'i 'khor lo'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThirty-two‚Äù means the navel cakra.

original: rgyud mang por zhes bya ba ni kye'i rdo rje 'bum phrag lnga'i bdag nyid du'o //
analyzed: rgyud mang por zhes bya ba ni kye'i rdo rje 'bum phrag lnga'i bdag nyid du'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn many tantras‚Äù means in the Hevajra Tantra in five hundred thousand lines.

original: de lta bu'i gzugs su gnas zhes bya ba ni bshad pa'i 'khor lo bzhi'i rtsa bskyed pa rnams kyi de rnams su rang bzhin bskyed pa rnams kyi gzugs rnams te de rnams kyi gzugs su gzugs can ma gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bu'i gzugs su gnas zhes bya ba ni bshad pa'i 'khor lo bzhi'i rtsa bskyed pa rnams kyi de rnams su rang bzhin bskyed pa rnams kyi gzugs rnams te de rnams kyi gzugs su gzugs can ma gnas pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúResides in such a form‚Äù means that in those places where the naturally arisen forms of the channels of the four cakras explained above are generated, the forms of the naturally arisen forms reside in the form of R≈´pi·πáƒ´.

original: de'i rnam par rtog pas phyi rol gyi dngos por brtags pas de de bzhin no //
analyzed: de'i rnam par rtog pas phyi rol gyi dngos por brtags pas de de bzhin no //
translated: By the conception of external things through the conception of those, it is so.

original: da ni ming gi yi ge rnams kyis rigs par bskyed pa gsungs pa bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba la sogs pas gzugs can ma 'dri ba ste rgyu'i yi ge ni gang gi phyir gyi don te //
analyzed: da ni ming gi yi ge rnams kyis rigs par bskyed pa gsungs pa bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba la sogs pas gzugs can ma 'dri ba ste rgyu'i yi ge ni gang gi phyir gyi don te //
translated: Now, the question of R≈´pi·πáƒ´ is stated by the words ‚ÄúBlessed One‚Äù and so on, with the syllables of the name. The causal syllable is for the sake of what.

original: de sngon du gzugs can ma'i rang bzhin gyi yi ge gsungs pa'i ming gi yi ge bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs shig pa'o //
analyzed: de sngon du gzugs can ma'i rang bzhin gyi yi ge gsungs pa'i ming gi yi ge bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs shig pa'o //

original: de'i tshe bcom ldan 'das kyis lan gsungs pa /
analyzed: de'i tshe bcom ldan 'das kyis lan gsungs pa /
translated: At that time, the Blessed One spoke the reply:

original: gzugs med ces bya ba la sogs pa ste sogs pa'i sgras sngar bshad pa'i sku gsum kyang ngo //
analyzed: gzugs med ces bya ba la sogs pa ste sogs pa'i sgras sngar bshad pa'i sku gsum kyang ngo //
translated: Formless, etc. The term etc. includes the three previously explained bodies.

original: de rnam par dag @111a * //
analyzed: de rnam par dag @111a * //
translated: That is pure.

original: pa gdan gyi tshig 'di ni ru'i yi ge'o //
analyzed: pa gdan gyi tshig 'di ni ru'i yi ge'o //
translated: This word of the seat is the syllable ru.

original: pha zhes bya ba ni p'i yi ge'i don to //
analyzed: pha zhes bya ba ni p'i yi ge'i don to //
translated: Father is the meaning of the syllable pha.

original: 'khyer bar byed ces bya ba ni ni'i yi ge'i don to //
analyzed: 'khyer bar byed ces bya ba ni ni'i yi ge'i don to //
translated: Bearing is the meaning of the syllable ni.

original: 'gags pas zhes bya ba ni yan lag 'di rnams thams cad du sna tshogs pa'i tshig rnams kyi rnams par rtog pa'i nang du chos kyi dbyings kyi gnas rnams su nges par bcug pa ste de bzhin du mngon sum du gyur par gnas so //
analyzed: 'gags pas zhes bya ba ni yan lag 'di rnams thams cad du sna tshogs pa'i tshig rnams kyi rnams par rtog pa'i nang du chos kyi dbyings kyi gnas rnams su nges par bcug pa ste de bzhin du mngon sum du gyur par gnas so //
translated: By stopping - all these limbs are definitely placed in the various words and conceptual thoughts within the abodes of the dharmadhatu, and thus they abide in actuality.

original: de yis lhan cig skyes pa'i yang dag pa'i byang chub tu 'dod ces bya ba ni dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo'i rang bzhin bsgoms pa yis kyang ste 'dod pa ni 'thob pa'o //
analyzed: de yis lhan cig skyes pa'i yang dag pa'i byang chub tu 'dod ces bya ba ni dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo'i rang bzhin bsgoms pa yis kyang ste 'dod pa ni 'thob pa'o //
translated: By that,one attains the innate perfect enlightenment,by meditating on the nature of the mandala circle,one attains it.

original: dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo ni sngon bzhin du gzugs can ma bdag po ste kun du spyod pa'i las kyis so //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo ni sngon bzhin du gzugs can ma bdag po ste kun du spyod pa'i las kyis so //
translated: The mandala circle is the lord of the form realm, as before, by the action of universal practice.

original: de nyid de ltar yang g-yas pa'i 'dab ma'i gzugs can ma bdag po'i gnas su 'ongs bas de rdo rje phag mo dang mkha' 'gro ma dang l'a ma dang khanda ro ha'i rang bzhin gyi gzugs can mar 'gyur ro //

translated: Since the childish mind does not understand beneficial and non-beneficial things, for those ignorant and fallen ones, there is no enlightenment. Like the worm that makes the anthill, they are bound by self-awareness in sa·πÉsƒÅra.

original: byang chub sems zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste dga' ba che la sogs pas zhes bya ba ni rnal 'byor ma rnams kyi dbang po gnyis kun du sbyor ba las byang chub kyi sems rnam par bzung bas so //
analyzed: byang chub sems zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste dga' ba che la sogs pas zhes bya ba ni rnal 'byor ma rnams kyi dbang po gnyis kun du sbyor ba las byang chub kyi sems rnam par bzung bas so //
translated: The bodhicitta and so on is the great joy and so on, that is, by the union of the two organs of the yoginƒ´s, the bodhicitta is retained.

original: keng rus bdud rtsi 'gugs pa mo //
analyzed: keng rus bdud rtsi 'gugs pa mo //
translated: The skeleton is the summoner of nectar.

original: zhes bya ba ni 'dir rus kyi sgras thos pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'dir rus kyi sgras thos pa ste /
translated: Here, the word skeleton is heard.

original: de la gnas pa'i byang chub kyi sems gnas pa yang 'gugs pa ste rkang kyang ngo //
analyzed: de la gnas pa'i byang chub kyi sems gnas pa yang 'gugs pa ste rkang kyang ngo //
translated: The bodhicitta that abides there is also summoned, and it is the foot.

original: de dag 'gugs pa ni 'dren pa mo ste bdud rtsi zab mo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de dag 'gugs pa ni 'dren pa mo ste bdud rtsi zab mo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: That which summons them is the summoner, and the meaning of nectar is profound.

original: na'i yi ge gsungs pa /
analyzed: na'i yi ge gsungs pa /
translated: The syllable ni is stated.

original: de'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The nature of those is attachment and so on.

original: de dag gi rang bzhin chags sogs kun zhes bya ba ni sogs pa'i sgras 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang / gti mug dang nga rgyal dang phrag dog dang ser sna la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de dag gi rang bzhin chags sogs kun zhes bya ba ni sogs pa'i sgras 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang / gti mug dang nga rgyal dang phrag dog dang ser sna la sogs pa ste /
translated: The phrase and so on includes desire, anger, ignorance, pride, jealousy, stinginess, and so on.

original: 'on kyang rang gi ngo bo las kyang 'dod chags la sogs pa'i sgra ni sad pa dang rmi lam dang gnyid dang bzhi pa'i rang bzhin gyi dga' ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang rang gi ngo bo las kyang 'dod chags la sogs pa'i sgra ni sad pa dang rmi lam dang gnyid dang bzhi pa'i rang bzhin gyi dga' ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: But the terms ‚Äúpassion‚Äù and so on are also used for the joys of the nature of the fourth state, which is the waking, dream, and deep sleep states.

original: de ltar / bzhi pa 'das pa zag pa med //
analyzed: de ltar / bzhi pa 'das pa zag pa med //
translated: Thus, the fourth is beyond the outflows, and is immaculate.

original: ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: ces bya ba ni /
translated: This is the meaning of the verse.

original: zag pa'i dus su bzhi ba yongs su 'dzin par byed de /
analyzed: zag pa'i dus su bzhi ba yongs su 'dzin par byed de /
translated: At the time of the outflows, one retains the fourth.

original: de dag las 'das pa ni 'pho bar mi byed pa ste /
analyzed: de dag las 'das pa ni 'pho bar mi byed pa ste /
translated: Beyond that, one does not move,

original: zag pa med pa mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i rang bzhin can ma zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zag pa med pa mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i rang bzhin can ma zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: and the immaculate, supreme, unchanging nature is called the ‚Äúfourth.‚Äù

original: 'dir s'u ka ra'i yi ge gsum gyi dpe gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'dir s'u ka ra'i yi ge gsum gyi dpe gsungs pa /
translated: Here, the three syllables of S≈´k·π£ma are given as an example.

original: ji ltar yang phag mo rdo rje'i mchu ste /
analyzed: ji ltar yang phag mo rdo rje'i mchu ste /
translated: Just as a sow has a snout,

original: de bzhin du rigs can gyi lte ba'i rtsa rdo rje khab rdo rje'i mchu'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rigs can gyi lte ba'i rtsa rdo rje khab rdo rje'i mchu'o //
translated: so the channel of the family at the navel is a vajra needle, a snout.

original: de bzhin du yang ji ltar phag mo skud pa lta bur kun du 'gro ba de'i zhal phyag khyog go //
analyzed: de bzhin du yang ji ltar phag mo skud pa lta bur kun du 'gro ba de'i zhal phyag khyog go //
translated: And just as a sow moves about like a thread, so her face and hands are turned around.

original: de bzhin du ste skud pa lta bu ste rtsa lam kun du 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du ste skud pa lta bu ste rtsa lam kun du 'gro ba'o //
translated: So, like a thread, the channel moves about everywhere.

original: de ltar phag mo sa gzhi las sangs ma pa rtsa ba nas 'don pa dang ma lus pa shin tu @121a * //üîΩ'dzin nus te /
analyzed: de ltar phag mo sa gzhi las sangs ma pa rtsa ba nas 'don pa dang ma lus pa shin tu @121a * // 'dzin nus te /
translated: Thus, the sow, who is the earth, is never extracted from the root, and she is able to hold everything without exception.

original: de bzhin du byang chub kyi sems bde ba chen po las keng rus kyi bdud rtsi 'gugs pa mo ste rtsa gtum mo'i gzugs can ma'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du byang chub kyi sems bde ba chen po las keng rus kyi bdud rtsi 'gugs pa mo ste rtsa gtum mo'i gzugs can ma'o //
translated: In the same way, the great bliss of the thought of enlightenment is the sow who attracts the nectar of the skeleton, who has the form of the channel rasanƒÅ.

original: ji ltar yang phag mo dus thams cad du rtsol ba rnams su 'dod chags la sogs pa thams cad de'i rang bzhin rnams kyis de la thim pa'i rang bzhin gyis bde ba za ba'o //
analyzed: ji ltar yang phag mo dus thams cad du rtsol ba rnams su 'dod chags la sogs pa thams cad de'i rang bzhin rnams kyis de la thim pa'i rang bzhin gyis bde ba za ba'o //
translated: And just as the sow is always in the wombs, so also is the yogi, who is the nature of all the desires such as passion, etc., in the nature of the dissolution of those desires, and he eats the bliss.

original: de lta bu'i 'du shes rnam par spangs pa rang gi lam nas mi 'pho ba'o //
analyzed: de lta bu'i 'du shes rnam par spangs pa rang gi lam nas mi 'pho ba'o //
translated: And just as the sow does not move from her own place, so also the yogi, who has abandoned the notion of such a kind, does not move from his own place.

original: de bzhin du rnal 'byor pas rtsol ba'i las thams cad kyi 'dod chags la sogs pa de'i rang bzhin du bdag gis mchog tu zag pa med par bya ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rnal 'byor pas rtsol ba'i las thams cad kyi 'dod chags la sogs pa de'i rang bzhin du bdag gis mchog tu zag pa med par bya ba'o //
translated: In the same way, the yogi, by all the actions of the channels, should make the desires such as passion, etc., into the nature of that, and he should make them supreme and without outflows.

original: nga rgyal spangs pa de la thim pas rang gi lam nas mi 'pho ba zhes bya ba ni mchog tu zag pa med pa'o //
analyzed: nga rgyal spangs pa de la thim pas rang gi lam nas mi 'pho ba zhes bya ba ni mchog tu zag pa med pa'o //
translated: The non-transference of the seed through one's own path is the supreme, uncontaminated state.

original: de ltar de nas zhes bya ba ni phyogs gzhan te /
analyzed: de ltar de nas zhes bya ba ni phyogs gzhan te /
translated: Thus, then refers to another stage.

original: gal te rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi rdo rje dang padma mnyam par 'dug pa'i dus su sa bon ltung ngo //
analyzed: gal te rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi rdo rje dang padma mnyam par 'dug pa'i dus su sa bon ltung ngo //
translated: If the seed falls at the time of the union of the vajra and lotus of the yogis,

original: de'i tshe bsgom pa'i bdag nyid kyis rang gi 'pho ba'i dus su 'chad par 'gyur ba rnams kyis so //
analyzed: de'i tshe bsgom pa'i bdag nyid kyis rang gi 'pho ba'i dus su 'chad par 'gyur ba rnams kyis so //
translated: then, by the nature of meditation, it should be transferred through the methods that will be explained.

original: brgyad du zhes bya ba ni khva gdong ma la sogs pa rnams kyi rnam par gzhag pa mngal 'pho ba la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: brgyad du zhes bya ba ni khva gdong ma la sogs pa rnams kyi rnam par gzhag pa mngal 'pho ba la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: The eight are the eight goddesses beginning with KƒÅkƒÅsyƒÅ, who are established in the transference of the womb, etc.

original: de ltar de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Thus, then and so on.

original: de ltar yang dag pa'i rtsol ba zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de ltar yang dag pa'i rtsol ba zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Thus, right effort is

original: rkang pa gcig gis ma longs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa bzhi ni rtogs par sla ba zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rkang pa gcig gis ma longs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa bzhi ni rtogs par sla ba zhes bya ba'o //
translated: the four lines that are missing one line, which is called easy to understand.

original: gzhan zhes bya ba ni gnas skabs bcu ste /
analyzed: gzhan zhes bya ba ni gnas skabs bcu ste /
translated: The other is the ten stages.

original: ji ltar khyab 'jug gis rab tu bshad pa'i phyi rol pa'i 'jug pa nya la sogs pa de rnams su ni mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji ltar khyab 'jug gis rab tu bshad pa'i phyi rol pa'i 'jug pa nya la sogs pa de rnams su ni mi 'gyur ro //
translated: It is not like the external entry of Vi·π£·πáu, as explained by the fish and so on.

original: ci'i phyir 'dir gang gi phyir khyab 'jug gi lta ba la gnas pa rnams kyi rang gi tshig dang 'gal te /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'dir gang gi phyir khyab 'jug gi lta ba la gnas pa rnams kyi rang gi tshig dang 'gal te /
translated: Why is that? Because those who abide in the view of Vi·π£·πáu contradict their own words.

original: de ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: de ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?üîΩIt is said:

original: gsungs pa / thams cad khyab 'jug rang bzhin dngos //
analyzed: gsungs pa / thams cad khyab 'jug rang bzhin dngos //
translated: All things are of the nature of Vi·π£·πáu,

original: de bzhin rang nyid 'phrog dang byed //
analyzed: de bzhin rang nyid 'phrog dang byed //
translated: And he himself creates and withdraws.

original: srog chags kun dang 'byung bdag nyid //
analyzed: srog chags kun dang 'byung bdag nyid //
translated: He is the lord of all beings and elements,

original: grol dang longs spyod mthar de bzhin //
analyzed: grol dang longs spyod mthar de bzhin //
translated: Liberated and enjoying the ultimate.

original: srog gi gzugs su 'tsho bdag nyid //
analyzed: srog gi gzugs su 'tsho bdag nyid //
translated: In the form of life, he is the lord of life,

original: thams cad du ni khyab 'jug gnas //
analyzed: thams cad du ni khyab 'jug gnas //
translated: Vi·π£·πáu abides everywhere.

original: thog ma tha ma dbus gnas nas //
analyzed: thog ma tha ma dbus gnas nas //
translated: Abiding from beginning, end, and middle,

original: nam du yang ni g-yo ba med //
analyzed: nam du yang ni g-yo ba med //
translated: He never moves at all.

original: ces bya ba 'di la sogs pa rang gi tshig gis bshad do //
analyzed: ces bya ba 'di la sogs pa rang gi tshig gis bshad do //
translated: This and so on is explained by their own words.

original: slar yang khyab 'jug gi 'jug pa bcus 'jug pa ste nya la sogs pas de'i tshe rim gyis @121b 'jug pas 'gro bas na da nga'i 'jug pa la mi gnas pas sangs rgyas pa rnams la sngon du nyams so //
analyzed: slar yang khyab 'jug gi 'jug pa bcus 'jug pa ste nya la sogs pas de'i tshe rim gyis @121b 'jug pas 'gro bas na da nga'i 'jug pa la mi gnas pas sangs rgyas pa rnams la sngon du nyams so //
translated: Again, by the ten entries of Vishnu, the entry is by fish and so on, since at that time the world gradually entered by those. Now, since it does not abide in my entry, the Buddhists first declined.

original: de'i phyir thams cad khyab 'jug gi rang bzhin la sogs pa mi srid pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir thams cad khyab 'jug gi rang bzhin la sogs pa mi srid pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, since it is impossible that everything is the nature of Vishnu and so on,

original: de'i tshe sangs rgyas pa rnams kyi bstan pa'i tshig can no //
analyzed: de'i tshe sangs rgyas pa rnams kyi bstan pa'i tshig can no //
translated: at that time the Buddhists had a teaching.

original: des nya la sogs pa mngal du 'gro ba'i gnas skabs bcu bstan pa'o //
analyzed: des nya la sogs pa mngal du 'gro ba'i gnas skabs bcu bstan pa'o //
translated: That teaches the ten states of the fish and so on entering the womb.

original: 'di bshad pas ci sgrub gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'di bshad pas ci sgrub gsungs pa /
translated: What is accomplished by explaining this?

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gnas skabs bcu'i 'jug pas 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gnas skabs bcu'i 'jug pas 'jug pa ste /
translated: The Bhagavan Buddha entered by the ten states of entry.

original: khyab 'jug gis ma yin no //
analyzed: khyab 'jug gis ma yin no //
translated: It was not by Vishnu.

original: de ltar 'jug pa zhes bya ba ni dngos po thams cad du 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar 'jug pa zhes bya ba ni dngos po thams cad du 'jug pa ste /
translated: Thus, ‚Äúentry‚Äù is the entry into all things.

original: de'i rang bzhin nyid kyis sangs rgyas rnams kyi 'dir de ltar thams cad bden pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin nyid kyis sangs rgyas rnams kyi 'dir de ltar thams cad bden pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Since that is the nature of the buddhas, here everything is true.

original: 'jug med ces bya ba ni de ltar bdag dang bdag gi ba'i dngos po rnams kyis mi 'dzin pa nyid pas lhan cig skyas pa'i byang chub kyi mtshan nyid kyis so //
analyzed: 'jug med ces bya ba ni de ltar bdag dang bdag gi ba'i dngos po rnams kyis mi 'dzin pa nyid pas lhan cig skyas pa'i byang chub kyi mtshan nyid kyis so //
translated: ‚ÄúWithout engagement‚Äù means that, since one does not grasp at the entities of self and ‚Äúmine‚Äù in that way, one is endowed with the characteristic of enlightenment.üîΩ‚ÄúThe domain of entities‚Äù means that the domain of entities is the very enlightenment of the bodhisattvas who experience the variety of objects.

original: de'i dngos po'i spyod yul zhes bya ba ni dngos po'i spyod yul nye bar spyod pa'i sna tshogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi thugs dgongs de nyid kyis byang chub par gyur pa nyid kyis de'i dngos po'i spyod yul te /
analyzed: de'i dngos po'i spyod yul zhes bya ba ni dngos po'i spyod yul nye bar spyod pa'i sna tshogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi thugs dgongs de nyid kyis byang chub par gyur pa nyid kyis de'i dngos po'i spyod yul te /
translated: Since it is enlightened by that very enlightenment, it is the domain of entities.

original: byang chub rnam par 'gyur ba med pa'i bdag nyid kyi dngos po nye bar spyod pas rab tu 'jug ste mchog tu gnyis su med pa zhes bya ba'i don to ;
analyzed: byang chub rnam par 'gyur ba med pa'i bdag nyid kyi dngos po nye bar spyod pas rab tu 'jug ste mchog tu gnyis su med pa zhes bya ba'i don to ;
translated: It is engaged by experiencing the entity that is the nature of unchanging enlightenment. The meaning is that it is supremely nondual.

original: / rnam par 'gyur ba yang rkang gnyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste rtsol ba'i yan lag la 'jog pas rab tu 'jug pa sna tshogs pa'i rnam pas so //
analyzed: / rnam par 'gyur ba yang rkang gnyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste rtsol ba'i yan lag la 'jog pas rab tu 'jug pa sna tshogs pa'i rnam pas so //
translated: ‚ÄúChange‚Äù is the engagement of the two feet, etc. It is engaged by the variety of modes of exertion.

original: de rnams kyi 'jug pa med pa'i de kho na nyid la rtag tu zhes bya ba ni sngar bshad pa'i byang chub tu gyur pa de las te rnal 'byor ma mthong ba dang reg pa dang 'chad par 'gyur ba'i sgom pa yis kyang ngo //
analyzed: de rnams kyi 'jug pa med pa'i de kho na nyid la rtag tu zhes bya ba ni sngar bshad pa'i byang chub tu gyur pa de las te rnal 'byor ma mthong ba dang reg pa dang 'chad par 'gyur ba'i sgom pa yis kyang ngo //
translated: The constant in the reality of their non-engagement is from that enlightenment explained above, and also from the yoga-woman, the seeing, the touching, and the meditation to be explained.

original: da ni 'di'i sgom pa dang kun du spyod pa dang / de bzhin du sngags dgod pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: da ni 'di'i sgom pa dang kun du spyod pa dang / de bzhin du sngags dgod pa gsungs pa /
translated: Now, here he explains the meditation, the conduct, and likewise the mantra placement.

original: sor mo zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: sor mo zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: [He says,] finger and so forth.

original: rdo rje'i dkyil 'khor dbus su zhes bya ba ni dbus ma'i dbus su ste /
analyzed: rdo rje'i dkyil 'khor dbus su zhes bya ba ni dbus ma'i dbus su ste /
translated: In the middle of the vajra mandala means in the middle of the center.

original: sngon bzhin du dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo bsgom par bya'o zhes bya'o zhes bya ba ste thabs dang shas rab kyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: sngon bzhin du dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo bsgom par bya'o zhes bya'o zhes bya ba ste thabs dang shas rab kyi rang bzhin no //
translated: Meditate on the wheel of the mandala as before means that [it is] the nature of means and insight.

original: kun du spyod pa rang gi 'pho ba ni seng ge zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //
analyzed: kun du spyod pa rang gi 'pho ba ni seng ge zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //
translated: The conduct is one's own transference, with lion and so forth.

original: dbus bdag po'i gnas nas khyi gdong ma lho'i sgor 'gro'o //
analyzed: dbus bdag po'i gnas nas khyi gdong ma lho'i sgor 'gro'o //
translated: From the middle lord's place, the dog-faced [dakini] goes to the south door.

original: de la gnas pa'i phag gdong ma bdag po'i gnas su yang 'od do @122a * //
analyzed: de la gnas pa'i phag gdong ma bdag po'i gnas su yang 'od do @122a * //
translated: The pig-faced one who is located there goes to the place of the lord.

original: de ltar phag gdong ma de rdo rje phag mo dang bya rog dang 'ug pa dang khyi gdong ma'i rang bzhin du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar phag gdong ma de rdo rje phag mo dang bya rog dang 'ug pa dang khyi gdong ma'i rang bzhin du 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, that pig-faced one becomes VajravƒÅrƒÅhƒ´, the crow-faced one, the owl-faced one, and the dog-faced one.

original: khyi gdong ma yang gnas kyi dbang gis rdo rje phag mo dang bya rog ma dang 'ug pa ma dang phag gdong ma'i rang bzhin du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khyi gdong ma yang gnas kyi dbang gis rdo rje phag mo dang bya rog ma dang 'ug pa ma dang phag gdong ma'i rang bzhin du 'gyur ro //
translated: The dog-faced one also becomes VajravƒÅrƒÅhƒ´, the crow-faced one, the owl-faced one, and the pig-faced one by the power of the location.

original: slang yang phag gdong ma shar gyi sgor 'ongs te de la gnas pa'i rdo rje phag mo bdag po'i gnas su 'gro'o //

translated: Thus, they enter into their own nature. Those who are without merit, who are sinful, are burned by the sufferings of death, etc.

original: rnal 'byor pa bsod nams dang ldan pa de kho na nyid 'dzin pa de rnams kyis las kyi 'chi ba'i dus su dngos po yang slu bar byed do //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa bsod nams dang ldan pa de kho na nyid 'dzin pa de rnams kyis las kyi 'chi ba'i dus su dngos po yang slu bar byed do //
translated: But those yogins who have merit, who are holders of reality, they are deceived by the thing at the time of death, which is an action.

original: gcig tu na yang 'chi ba'i dus su bslu ba ni ma yin te mchog ces bya ba ni mchog tu mya ngan las 'das pa 'thob pa'o /
analyzed: gcig tu na yang 'chi ba'i dus su bslu ba ni ma yin te mchog ces bya ba ni mchog tu mya ngan las 'das pa 'thob pa'o /
translated: The supreme is the attainment of supreme nirvana.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i 'khor ba la pha rol tu 'gro ba'i phyir de la /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i 'khor ba la pha rol tu 'gro ba'i phyir de la /
translated: Because it goes beyond samsara, such as attachment, etc.,üîΩit is said to be immortal and undeceiving.

original: 'chi ba med cing bslu ba yang med ces bya ba ste nyon mongs pa'i phung po rnams kyis brtan pa tsam du bstan pa ni kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i nges pa'o //
analyzed: 'chi ba med cing bslu ba yang med ces bya ba ste nyon mongs pa'i phung po rnams kyis brtan pa tsam du bstan pa ni kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i nges pa'o //
translated: The teaching of mere stability by the aggregates of afflictions is the conventional and ultimate certainties.

original: da ni 'di rnams kyi kun rdzob dang don dam pa gnyis kyi dgos pa dang byed pa'i mtshan nyid kyi rang bzhin gyi man ngag gsungs pa /
analyzed: da ni 'di rnams kyi kun rdzob dang don dam pa gnyis kyi dgos pa dang byed pa'i mtshan nyid kyi rang bzhin gyi man ngag gsungs pa /
translated: Now, here is the instruction on the nature of the purpose and function of both the conventional and the ultimate:

original: ston ka zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: ston ka zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Autumn and so on.

original: de ni mngon par brjod ces bya ba'i bar du byed pa dang las kyang ngo //
analyzed: de ni mngon par brjod ces bya ba'i bar du byed pa dang las kyang ngo //
translated: It is the function and action up to it is verbal expression.

original: de thams cad rtogs par sla'o //
analyzed: de thams cad rtogs par sla'o //
translated: All of that is easy to understand.

original: de phyir byis pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas rang gi mtshan nyid ces bya ba'i bar du zhes bya ba yang ste kun rdzob ste rtogs par sla'o //
analyzed: de phyir byis pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas rang gi mtshan nyid ces bya ba'i bar du zhes bya ba yang ste kun rdzob ste rtogs par sla'o //
translated: Therefore, ‚Äúchildish‚Äù and so forth up to ‚Äúown characteristic‚Äù is the conventional, which is easy to understand.

original: de nas don dam pa gnyis su med pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nas don dam pa gnyis su med pa gsungs pa /
translated: Then, the ultimate non-duality is stated:

original: slar yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste tshigs su bcad pa gnyis kyis bya ba dang byed pa ste don dam pa ste rtogs par sla'o //
analyzed: slar yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste tshigs su bcad pa gnyis kyis bya ba dang byed pa ste don dam pa ste rtogs par sla'o //
translated: ‚ÄúAgain‚Äù and so forth, two verses on the ultimate, which is easy to understand.

original: de bzhin du 'dir 'dis de ltar @128b dus ma yin par 'chi ba'i rab tu sbyor ba gsungs pa /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dir 'dis de ltar @128b dus ma yin par 'chi ba'i rab tu sbyor ba gsungs pa /
translated: Similarly, here, this is stated as the application of untimely death:

original: srog rgyu ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste thog med yud tsam zhes bya ba'i bar du rtogs par sla'o //
analyzed: srog rgyu ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste thog med yud tsam zhes bya ba'i bar du rtogs par sla'o //
translated: ‚ÄúLife force‚Äù and so forth up to ‚Äúbeginningless moment‚Äù is easy to understand.

original: da ni dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo bsgom pa dang sngags dgod pa dang kun du spyod pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: da ni dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo bsgom pa dang sngags dgod pa dang kun du spyod pa gsungs pa /
translated: Now, the meditation on the ma·πá·∏çala wheel, the arrangement of the mantras, and the conduct are stated:

original: kha dog ces bya ba la sogs pa ste bsgom pa ni rtogs par sla'o //
analyzed: kha dog ces bya ba la sogs pa ste bsgom pa ni rtogs par sla'o //
translated: ‚ÄúColor‚Äù and so forth, the meditation is easy to understand.

original: lhan skyes sbyor bas rdo rje 'dzin //
analyzed: lhan skyes sbyor bas rdo rje 'dzin //
translated: The vajra holder is born simultaneously with the union.

original: zhes bya ba ni dbu mar dkyil 'khor rab tu zhugs pas lhan cig skyes pa ste de'i sbyor bas ni 'pho ba med pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni dbu mar dkyil 'khor rab tu zhugs pas lhan cig skyes pa ste de'i sbyor bas ni 'pho ba med pa'o //
translated: Thus, arisen together means that by entering the mandala in the middle, one is without transference by the yoga of that.

original: rdo rje 'dzin zhes bya ba ni der 'chad par 'gyur ba'i dbus su bsgom par bya dgos so //
analyzed: rdo rje 'dzin zhes bya ba ni der 'chad par 'gyur ba'i dbus su bsgom par bya dgos so //
translated: The vajra-holder is to be meditated on in the middle, as will be explained.

original: de ltar kha sbyar gyi sngags kyi yi ge rnams gsungs pa /
analyzed: de ltar kha sbyar gyi sngags kyi yi ge rnams gsungs pa /
translated: Thus, he states the mantra syllables of the embrace.

original: aom ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: aom ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Om ma, etc.

original: de la aom ma h'a dh'u mbr'andha k'a ra wa pu sh'a ya h'um h'um phat phat sv'a h'a /
analyzed: de la aom ma h'a dh'u mbr'andha k'a ra wa pu sh'a ya h'um h'um phat phat sv'a h'a /

original: de bzhin du aom badzra ya ma ma tha n'i ye h'um h'um phat phat sv'a h'a /üîΩzhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du aom badzra ya ma ma tha n'i ye h'um h'um phat phat sv'a h'a / zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Likewise, om vajra yama mathani ye hum hum phat phat sva ha.

original: lhag ma rtogs par sla'o //
analyzed: lhag ma rtogs par sla'o //
translated: The rest is easy to understand.

original: thim dang longs spyod sogs byed ma //
analyzed: thim dang longs spyod sogs byed ma //
translated: The one who dissolves and enjoys, etc.

original: zhes bya ba ni kun du spyod pa gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni kun du spyod pa gsungs te /

original: gshin rje mche gtsigs ma bdag po'i gnas nas dbang ldan gyi mtshams su 'gro'o //
analyzed: gshin rje mche gtsigs ma bdag po'i gnas nas dbang ldan gyi mtshams su 'gro'o //

original: de yang gnas kyi dbang gis gshin rje 'joms ma'i rang bzhin du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yang gnas kyi dbang gis gshin rje 'joms ma'i rang bzhin du 'gyur ro //

original: de la gnas pa bdag po'i gnas su 'ong ngo /
analyzed: de la gnas pa bdag po'i gnas su 'ong ngo /

original: de rdo rje phag mo dang brtan ma dang pho nya ma dang mche gtsigs ma'i rang bzhin du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de rdo rje phag mo dang brtan ma dang pho nya ma dang mche gtsigs ma'i rang bzhin du 'gyur ro //

analyzed: gshin rje 'joms ma zhes bya ba la ni 'di rnams thams cad thim pa'o //

analyzed: me'i grva nas rdo rje phag mo dbus su 'ong ngo //

original: de la gnas pa'i gshin rje 'joms ma yang me'i grva la 'gro'o //
analyzed: de la gnas pa'i gshin rje 'joms ma yang me'i grva la 'gro'o //

analyzed: slar yang dbus nas rdo rje phag mo bden bral du 'gro'o //

analyzed: der gnas pa'i gshin rje brtan ma yang dbus su 'ong ngo //

analyzed: de bzhin du de nyid mer 'gro'o //

analyzed: de la gnas pa'i gshin rje 'joms ma yang dbus su 'ong ngo //

analyzed: de yang bden bral du 'gro'o //

original: de la gnas pa'i rdo rje phag mo yang dbus su 'ong ngo //

analyzed: de la gnas pa'i rdo rje phag mo yang dbus su 'ong ngo //
translated: VajravƒÅrƒÅhƒ´ who resides there comes to the center.

analyzed: de la gnas pa'i 'joms ma yang dbus su 'ong ngo //

original: de yang dbang ldan du 'gro'o //
analyzed: de yang dbang ldan du 'gro'o //

original: der gnas pa'i rdo rje phag mo yang dbus su 'ong ba zhes bya ba ni rnal 'byor ma 'di rnams thams cad kyis shes par bya'o zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyi nges pa'o //

translated: This is to be known by all of these yoginƒ´s.

translated: Now, the Blessed Lord declares the cause of the self-making by the definition of the arrangement of all yoginƒ´s as having the nature of the Blessed Lord:

translated: The female pig and so forth. The one with the nature of emanation is the emanated form of Vajravarahi by the Blessed One, Great Vajradhara, emptiness by the condition of compassion.

original: tu'i yi ge ni nges par gzung ba'o //
analyzed: tu'i yi ge ni nges par gzung ba'o //
translated: The syllable tu is a definite article.

original: skyes pa srid pa nyams byed ma'o //
analyzed: skyes pa srid pa nyams byed ma'o //
translated: The one who destroys the existence of men.

original: zhes bya ba ni rkang gnyis la sogs pa'i 'jig rten pa skyes pa rnams kyi dngos po rnams rnam par nyams par byed ma ste 'dod chags la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rkang gnyis la sogs pa'i 'jig rten pa skyes pa rnams kyi dngos po rnams rnam par nyams par byed ma ste 'dod chags la sogs pa'o //
translated: The one who destroys the things of men, the worldly ones of two feet and so forth, is the one who destroys attachment and so forth.

original: chos chen po bstan pas de rnams kyis gzung ba dang 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i mngon par zhen pa nyams par byed pa'o //
analyzed: chos chen po bstan pas de rnams kyis gzung ba dang 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i mngon par zhen pa nyams par byed pa'o //
translated: By teaching the great Dharma, she destroys the clinging to subject and object and so forth.

original: de ltar ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa'i rang bzhin chos thams cad kyis so //
analyzed: de ltar ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa'i rang bzhin chos thams cad kyis so //
translated: Thus, by all dharmas, whose nature is empty of inherent existence,

original: de rnams kyis kyang bcom ldan 'das rdo rje'i sbyor ba chen pos zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyis kyang bcom ldan 'das rdo rje'i sbyor ba chen pos zhes bya ba'o //
translated: she also is the one who destroys by the great vajra yoga of the Blessed One.

original: rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis mchog tu zag pa med pa'i sbyor ba rnams kyis kyang ngo //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis mchog tu zag pa med pa'i sbyor ba rnams kyis kyang ngo //
translated: The yogis and yoginis, by means of the supreme, uncontaminated yoga,

original: de rnams kyis kyang rtsa thams cad la gnas pa rnams kyi rang bzhin @129b gyi lha rnams kyi rang bzhin lta bu'i chos kyi dbyings nyid kyis rab tu 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyis kyang rtsa thams cad la gnas pa rnams kyi rang bzhin @129b gyi lha rnams kyi rang bzhin lta bu'i chos kyi dbyings nyid kyis rab tu 'jug pa'o //
translated: also enter into the dharmadhatu, which is the nature of the deities who reside in all the channels.

original: de ltar bdag tu byed pa rnams 'khor los sgyur ba nyid de rnal 'byor ma thams cad kyi bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar bdag tu byed pa rnams 'khor los sgyur ba nyid de rnal 'byor ma thams cad kyi bstan pa'o //
translated: Thus, the lords are the cakravartins, the teaching of all the yoginis.

original: da ni dngos po thams cad kyi 'khor los sgyur ba'i sbyor ba'i ye shes sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin du gsungs pa /
analyzed: da ni dngos po thams cad kyi 'khor los sgyur ba'i sbyor ba'i ye shes sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin du gsungs pa /
translated: Now, the wisdom of the yoga of the cakravartin of all things is stated to be the nature of the Buddha:

original: 'khor los sgyur ba chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'khor los sgyur ba chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúThe great cakravartin,‚Äù and so on.

original: byang chub sems dpa'o zhes bya ba'i bar rtogs par sla'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'o zhes bya ba'i bar rtogs par sla'o //
translated: Up to ‚Äúthe bodhisattva,‚Äù and so on, is easy to understand.

original: da ltar 'di'i nye bar bsdu ba'i glu gsungs pa /
analyzed: da ltar 'di'i nye bar bsdu ba'i glu gsungs pa /
translated: Now, the summary verse is stated:

original: dbang po zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: dbang po zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúThe sense faculties,‚Äù and so on.

original: dbang po rnams ni byang chub sems dpa'i skye bo yin zhes bya ba ni dbang po thams cad sangs rgyas kyi gzugs nyid pas de'i tshe gang zag so so rnams kyi yul gcig pas byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi gzugs su yang rig par bya'o //
analyzed: dbang po rnams ni byang chub sems dpa'i skye bo yin zhes bya ba ni dbang po thams cad sangs rgyas kyi gzugs nyid pas de'i tshe gang zag so so rnams kyi yul gcig pas byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi gzugs su yang rig par bya'o //
translated: The faculties are the Bodhisattvas, because all the faculties are the very form of the Buddha. At that time, the individual objects are the same for all, and so they should be known as the form of the Bodhisattvas.

original: yul rnams kyis ni sangs rgyas nyid du gyis //
analyzed: yul rnams kyis ni sangs rgyas nyid du gyis //
translated: The objects are the Buddhas.üîΩThe objects are the external ones, and the mind is the Buddha, because of the aspiration to Buddhahood by the karma of taking up the eye, etc. The meaning of ‚Äúperfect Buddha‚Äù is the purity of mind.

original: zhes bya ba ni yul rnams ni phyi rol gyi ste mig la sogs pas blangs pa'i las kyis yid la sangs rgyas nyid du mos pa gyis shig pa ste sems rnam par dag pa nyid pas rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas zhes bya ba'i don to //üîΩphung po zhes bya ba ni phung po lnga rnams sangs rgyas nyid de lhan cig gzung zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni yul rnams ni phyi rol gyi ste mig la sogs pas blangs pa'i las kyis yid la sangs rgyas nyid du mos pa gyis shig pa ste sems rnam par dag pa nyid pas rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas zhes bya ba'i don to // phung po zhes bya ba ni phung po lnga rnams sangs rgyas nyid de lhan cig gzung zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The aggregates are the Buddhas.

original: sangs rgyas sems can med par gcig ces bya ba'i tshig gis so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas sems can med par gcig ces bya ba'i tshig gis so //
translated: The aggregates are the five aggregates, which are the Buddhas. ‚Äú Together‚Äù means that they are the same, as stated by the words ‚Äúno Buddha, no sentient beings.‚Äù

original: mi shes pa'i dri mas bsgribs pa gang gi tshe de'i tshe sangs rgyas min no //
analyzed: mi shes pa'i dri mas bsgribs pa gang gi tshe de'i tshe sangs rgyas min no //
translated: When it is obscured by the stain of ignorance, then it is not a Buddha.

original: de'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin du phung po bya'o zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin du phung po bya'o zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, the aggregates are to be made into the nature of a Buddha.

original: khams rnams rdo rje 'dzin pa'i gzugs kyis zung //
analyzed: khams rnams rdo rje 'dzin pa'i gzugs kyis zung //
translated: The elements are to be grasped by the form of Vajradhara.

original: zhes bya ba ni sa la sogs pa'i khams rnams rdo rje 'chang gi rang bzhin gyis gzung bar bya'o zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sa la sogs pa'i khams rnams rdo rje 'chang gi rang bzhin gyis gzung bar bya'o zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The elements such as earth are to be grasped by the nature of Vajradhara.

original: gang gis 'pho ba med pa'i ye shes kyis byang chub khams thams cad zhu bar zhugs pa'i ye shes kyi khu bas de mi 'pho bar byas pas khams rnams rdo rje 'chang nyid du 'gro'o //
analyzed: gang gis 'pho ba med pa'i ye shes kyis byang chub khams thams cad zhu bar zhugs pa'i ye shes kyi khu bas de mi 'pho bar byas pas khams rnams rdo rje 'chang nyid du 'gro'o //
translated: By the gnosis that is not transferred, all the elements enter into the melted state of enlightenment, and by the nectar of gnosis that is not transferred, the elements go to the state of Vajradhara.

original: 'di ni de'i phyir de la de skad bshad do //
analyzed: 'di ni de'i phyir de la de skad bshad do //

original: srid par slar yang ldog par 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes bya ba ste /

original: de ltar byas pa la srid pa'i 'khor bar slar yang 'ong ba dang 'gro bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar byas pa la srid pa'i 'khor bar slar yang 'ong ba dang 'gro bar mi 'gyur ro //

analyzed: zhe sdang la sogs pa yang nye bar longs spyod pas kyang dmyal ba la sogs par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to//

original: @130a * // de ltar thams cad 'chi ba med pa'i rang bzhin du ni zung zhes bya ba ni de ltar phung po dang khams dang skye mched dang yul la sogs pa rnams 'chi ba med pa'i rang bzhin rnams su zung shig pa'o //

analyzed: thog ma med pa nas phung sum tshogs pa'i rgyud rnams kyi skye ba med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //

analyzed: de'i phyir 'chi ba med pha zhes bya ba'i don to //

translated: then in response to that, it is said that ≈öƒÅkyamuni and so on and the bodhisattvas are the nature of true compassion. Wherever they see sentient beings on a bad path, there they generate compassion.

analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gang dang gang gi phyi dang nang gi bdag nyid kyi dngos pos rnam par dpyad pas snying rje'i sbyor ba'i ting nge 'dzin byas nas gzhan gyi dgos pa ni mnyam pa med pa'i sems can gyi don bya ba ste thams cad mkhyen pa nyid
translated: This is the meaning: Having made the meditative stabilization of the application of compassion by analyzing whatever is with the entities of the outer and inner natures, the purpose of others is the benefit of sentient beings without equal, i.e., omniscience.

analyzed: dang rgya mtsho chen po dang gnyis su med pa'i ye shes ni rten te rang bzhin gyi 'jig rten gyi khams rnams su zhes bya ba ni bya skyibs so //
translated: and the great ocean are the nondual pristine consciousness that is the support, the naturally arisen world-systems.

original: de ltar gal te rus pa la sogs pa'i khams bdun rnams su kun nas 'dzin pa rnam par dpyod pa'i dus su rang bzhin gyi ye shes pa skyed pa de'i tshe khams kyi rnam par shes pa'i bdag nyid can no //
analyzed: de ltar gal te rus pa la sogs pa'i khams bdun rnams su kun nas 'dzin pa rnam par dpyod pa'i dus su rang bzhin gyi ye shes pa skyed pa de'i tshe khams kyi rnam par shes pa'i bdag nyid can no //
translated: Thus, if at the time of the analysis of the grasping of the seven elements such as bone, etc., the naturally arisen pristine consciousness is generated, then the elements are the nature of the consciousnesses.

original: rgya mtsho chen po'i 'gram rnams kyang rten te 'jig rten gyi khams kyi gnas kyang ngo //
analyzed: rgya mtsho chen po'i 'gram rnams kyang rten te 'jig rten gyi khams kyi gnas kyang ngo //
translated: The shores of the great ocean are the support, the place of the world-systems.

original: de bzhin du yang gal te ngag dang lag pa la sogs pa las kyi dbang po rnams kun nas 'dzin pa rnam par dpyod pa'i dus su rang bzhin rnam par skyes pa de'i tshe dmyal ba brgyad dur khrod chen po rnams kyi rten dang 'jig rten gyi khamsüîΩrnams kyi'o // skye bo med pa'i gnas zhes bya ba'i nges pa'o //üîΩphyi rol du yang yi ge'i don ni dur khrod du bya de la ni zhes bya ba ni thams cad kyi ting nge 'dzin rnams kyi kun nas 'dzin pa rnam par dpyod pa'i dus su ngag dang lag pa la sogs pa mi smra ba'i rnal 'byor gyis yang
analyzed: de bzhin du yang gal te ngag dang lag pa la sogs pa las kyi dbang po rnams kun nas 'dzin pa rnam par dpyod pa'i dus su rang bzhin rnam par skyes pa de'i tshe dmyal ba brgyad dur khrod chen po rnams kyi rten dang 'jig rten gyi khams rnams kyi'o // skye bo med pa'i gnas zhes bya ba'i nges pa'o // phyi rol du yang yi ge'i don ni dur khrod du bya de la ni zhes bya ba ni thams cad kyi ting nge 'dzin rnams kyi kun nas 'dzin pa rnam par dpyod pa'i dus su ngag dang lag pa la sogs pa mi smra ba'i rnal 'byor gyis yang
translated: In the same way, if the nature of the speech, hands, etc., the organs of action, is generated in the process of the analysis of the universal grasp, then at that time, in the eight hells, in the great cemeteries, the abodes of the worlds,

original: zhing skyong rnams la der gtor ma zhes bya ba ni 'dir sngon du bskal ba bsregs pa'i dus su mun pa la sogs pa dang sna tshogs pa'i nam mkha'i gnas rnams dang phra mo'i sems can gyi khams rnam par gnas pa'o //
analyzed: zhing skyong rnams la der gtor ma zhes bya ba ni 'dir sngon du bskal ba bsregs pa'i dus su mun pa la sogs pa dang sna tshogs pa'i nam mkha'i gnas rnams dang phra mo'i sems can gyi khams rnam par gnas pa'o //
translated: The oblation to the field-born ones is called here the first, because at the time of the burning of the aeon, the various abodes of the sky, such as darkness, and the realms of subtle sentient beings, abide there.

original: de rnams de'i tshe brten pa ni zhing can te /
analyzed: de rnams de'i tshe brten pa ni zhing can te /
translated: Those who abide there are the field-born ones.

original: de rnams la yang gtor ma sbyin pa ni thog mar me skye'o //
analyzed: de rnams la yang gtor ma sbyin pa ni thog mar me skye'o //
translated: The oblation to them is the first, the arising of fire.

original: des de rnams kyi bdud rtsi'i gzugs su bskyed do //
analyzed: des de rnams kyi bdud rtsi'i gzugs su bskyed do //
translated: By that, they are generated in the form of nectar.

original: sngon du rnal 'byor pa 'di rnams kyi ri ting nge 'dzin gyi dus su mnyam par gzhag pas rnam par shes pa la brten pa rnams tha mal pa las rang bzhin stong pa nyid kyi ye shes kyi bdag nyid can du de rnams kyi srog @132a * //
analyzed: sngon du rnal 'byor pa 'di rnams kyi ri ting nge 'dzin gyi dus su mnyam par gzhag pas rnam par shes pa la brten pa rnams tha mal pa las rang bzhin stong pa nyid kyi ye shes kyi bdag nyid can du de rnams kyi srog @132a * //
translated: At the time of the concentration of the yogin, the abiders in consciousness are ordinary, but by the wisdom of the nature of emptiness, they are generated as the nature of the deities.

original: mnyam pa las gtor ma ste khams rnams rgyas pa dang byang chub kyi sems zhub las so //
analyzed: mnyam pa las gtor ma ste khams rnams rgyas pa dang byang chub kyi sems zhub las so //
translated: The oblation is from the equality of their life-breaths, the increase of the elements and the melting of the bodhicitta.

original: phyi rol du yang sna tshogs pa'i nya dang sha la sogs pas de'i tshe sbyin par bya'o zhes bya ba ni nges pa'o //
analyzed: phyi rol du yang sna tshogs pa'i nya dang sha la sogs pas de'i tshe sbyin par bya'o zhes bya ba ni nges pa'o //
translated: And also externally, with various fish, meat, and so on, at that time one should give is the determination.

original: mchod yon la sogs dbul bar bya //
analyzed: mchod yon la sogs dbul bar bya //
translated: One should offer water for the feet, and so on.

original: zhes bya ba ni mchod yon la sogs pa ste zhabs bsil dang me tog dang bdug spos dang mar me dang dri dang de bzhin du ni lha bshos slar yang ngo //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni mchod yon la sogs pa ste zhabs bsil dang me tog dang bdug spos dang mar me dang dri dang de bzhin du ni lha bshos slar yang ngo //
translated: Water for the feet, and so on means water for the feet, flowers, incense, lamps, perfume, and likewise food offerings.

original: de ltar rgyu'i rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi rnam par bsam pa'i mtshan nyid rnam pa brgyad rnams bskyed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar rgyu'i rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi rnam par bsam pa'i mtshan nyid rnam pa brgyad rnams bskyed par 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, for the causal yogis, the eight aspects of the imagined characteristics are generated.

original: de yang yid ches bya ba ni me tog go //
analyzed: de yang yid ches bya ba ni me tog go //
translated: Moreover, faith is the flower.

original: srog ni bdug spos so //
analyzed: srog ni bdug spos so //
translated: Life is the incense.

original: bde ba ni mar me'o //
analyzed: bde ba ni mar me'o //
translated: Bliss is the lamp.

original: dri ni mngon par shes pa'o //
analyzed: dri ni mngon par shes pa'o //
translated: Scent is the superknowledges.

original: lha bshos ni chos kyi dbyings kyi bdag nyid can no //
analyzed: lha bshos ni chos kyi dbyings kyi bdag nyid can no //
translated: The food offering is the nature of the dharmadhƒÅtu.

original: de bzhin du mchod yon ni 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du mchod yon ni 'dod pa'o //
translated: Likewise, water for the feet is desire.

original: zhabs bsil dang zhal bsil ni gang zag dang chos kyi bdag med pa ste /
analyzed: zhabs bsil dang zhal bsil ni gang zag dang chos kyi bdag med pa ste /
translated: Water for the mouth and water for the feet are the selflessness of persons and phenomena.

original: rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi ye shes zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi ye shes zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the term is that it is the intuition of the yogis.

original: de ltar 'jig rten gyi khams kyi me tog ni nam mkha'o //
analyzed: de ltar 'jig rten gyi khams kyi me tog ni nam mkha'o //
translated: Thus, the flowers of the world-realms are the sky.

original: bdug spos ni rlung gi dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: bdug spos ni rlung gi dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: The incense is the circle of wind.

original: mar me ni me'i dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: mar me ni me'i dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: The lamps are the circle of fire.

original: zhabs bsil la sogs pa ni chu'i dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: zhabs bsil la sogs pa ni chu'i dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: The water for the feet, etc. are the circle of water.

original: dri ni sa'i dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: dri ni sa'i dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: The perfume is the circle of earth.

original: mchod yon ni gtun shing tsam gyi char ro //
analyzed: mchod yon ni gtun shing tsam gyi char ro //
translated: The libation is the rain the size of a sugar cane.

original: lha bshos ni thog ma nyid du sa'i steng gi bdud rtsi'o //
analyzed: lha bshos ni thog ma nyid du sa'i steng gi bdud rtsi'o //
translated: The food is the nectar of the earth itself.üîΩThe mouth-rinsing water is the compassion of the Buddhas, which is the mind that enters the world-realms of the Buddha-fields.

original: zhal bsil ni snying rje chen po rnams kyis sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi 'jig rten gyi khams su 'jug pa'i sems de gzhal med khang na spyod pa rnams kyis tshangs pa la sogs pa bskyed pa yang ngo //
analyzed: zhal bsil ni snying rje chen po rnams kyis sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi 'jig rten gyi khams su 'jug pa'i sems de gzhal med khang na spyod pa rnams kyis tshangs pa la sogs pa bskyed pa yang ngo //
translated: The mouth-rinsing water is the mouth-rinsing water of the gods, which is the creation of Brahma, etc. by those who move in the celestial palace.

original: kha'i gtsang sbra sogs sngon zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: kha'i gtsang sbra sogs sngon zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The purification of the mouth, etc. is first.

original: sogs pa'i sgras so shing kyang ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras so shing kyang ngo //
translated: The word etc. includes the tooth-stick.

original: sngon zhes bya ba ni nam langs pa dang langs la gtsang sbra la sogs pas bya'o //
analyzed: sngon zhes bya ba ni nam langs pa dang langs la gtsang sbra la sogs pas bya'o //
translated: The before is at dawn, and one should do it after rising, with purity, etc.

original: de ltar rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi sems ye shes su bskyed pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi sems ye shes su bskyed pa ste /
translated: Thus, the yogi's mind is generated into wisdom.

original: 'di la yang dngos po thams cad rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba sems kyi chos nyid ni gtsang sbra dag pa'o //
analyzed: 'di la yang dngos po thams cad rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba sems kyi chos nyid ni gtsang sbra dag pa'o //
translated: Here, the purity of the mind's reality, free from conceptualization of all things, is the purity of purity.

original: 'dod pa la sogs pa'i dri ma med pas kha bkru ba'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa la sogs pa'i dri ma med pas kha bkru ba'o //
translated: The rinsing of the mouth is without the stain of desire, etc.

original: 'di rnams thams cad du bden pa'i ngag gis ni so shing ngo //
analyzed: 'di rnams thams cad du bden pa'i ngag gis ni so shing ngo //
translated: In all of these, the tooth stick is with true speech.

original: de ltar 'jig rten gyi khams bskyed pa'i rgyu'i chos kyi gnas ni gtsang sbra'o //
analyzed: de ltar 'jig rten gyi khams bskyed pa'i rgyu'i chos kyi gnas ni gtsang sbra'o //
translated: Thus, purity is the cause of the creation of the world realm, the abode of Dharma.

original: thams cad ye @132b shes kyi rang bzhin gyi kha bkru ba'o //
analyzed: thams cad ye @132b shes kyi rang bzhin gyi kha bkru ba'o //
translated: The rinsing of the mouth is the nature of all wisdom.

original: dngos grub thams cad kyi rang bzhin ni so shing ste sngon du'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos grub thams cad kyi rang bzhin ni so shing ste sngon du'i phyir ro //
translated: The tooth stick is the nature of all powers, because it is prior.

original: slar yang bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: slar yang bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Again, the Blessed One, etc.

original: thang ka la sogs pa'i sku la dmigs nas ji ltar 'chad par 'byung pa'i sgom par bshad pa dang ldan pa ste de'i tshe rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi ye shes khams gsum gyi dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo'i rnam par so sor snang ngo //üîΩde rnams kyis kyang gzhal med khang na spyod pa rnams kyi dbus su tshangs pa'i gzhal yas khang rdzogs par byed de de'i rnam pa gzhal med khang na spyod pa rnams kyis bltas nas slar yang sngon gyi bag chags kyis khams gsum pa'i rnam pa tshangs pa la
analyzed: thang ka la sogs pa'i sku la dmigs nas ji ltar 'chad par 'byung pa'i sgom par bshad pa dang ldan pa ste de'i tshe rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi ye shes khams gsum gyi dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo'i rnam par so sor snang ngo // de rnams kyis kyang gzhal med khang na spyod pa rnams kyi dbus su tshangs pa'i gzhal yas khang rdzogs par byed de de'i rnam pa gzhal med khang na spyod pa rnams kyis bltas nas slar yang sngon gyi bag chags kyis khams gsum pa'i rnam pa tshangs pa la
translated: The yogins are the yogins, because they are the same as the yogins.üîΩ The yoginis are the yogins, because they are the same as the yoginis.üîΩ The yogins are the yogins, because they are the same as the yogins.üîΩ The yoginis are the yogins, because they are the same as the yoginis.üîΩ The yogins are the yogins, because they are the same as the yogins.üîΩ The yoginis are the yogins, because they are the same as the yoginis.üîΩ The yogins are the yogins, because they are the same as the yogins.üîΩ The yoginis are the yogins, because they are the same as the yoginis.üîΩ The yogins are the yogins, because they are the same as the yogins.üîΩ The yoginis are the yogins, because they are the same as the yoginis.

original: sogs pa'i lha rnams rjes su dran par byas nas blta ste bcom ldan 'das kyi bdag nyid can rnams so //üîΩyi dags gdan can drag chen po //
analyzed: sogs pa'i lha rnams rjes su dran par byas nas blta ste bcom ldan 'das kyi bdag nyid can rnams so // yi dags gdan can drag chen po //
translated: The yogins are the yogins, because they are the same as the yogins.üîΩ The yoginis are the yogins, because they are the same as the yoginis.üîΩ The yogins are the yogins, because they are the same as the yogins.üîΩ The yoginis are the yogins, because they are the same as the yoginis.

original: zhes bya ba ni phyi rol du rnam par rtog pa thams cad gzhom pa'i don du yi dags te ro'i gdan no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni phyi rol du rnam par rtog pa thams cad gzhom pa'i don du yi dags te ro'i gdan no //
translated: The yogins are the yogins, because they are the same as the yogins.üîΩ The yoginis are

original: dur khrod kyi dbus su rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis de'i ye shes las byung bas sngon gzhal med khang la nye bar spyod pa zhal bzhi pa tshangs pa chos kyi dbyings kyi bdag nyid can ni yi dags so //
analyzed: dur khrod kyi dbus su rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis de'i ye shes las byung bas sngon gzhal med khang la nye bar spyod pa zhal bzhi pa tshangs pa chos kyi dbyings kyi bdag nyid can ni yi dags so //
translated: In the middle of the charnel ground, the yogis and yoginis enjoy the celestial mansion that arose from his gnosis, the four-faced Brahma, the nature of the dharmadhatu, the preta.

original: gang phyir chos dbyings bdag nyid can //üîΩzhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang phyir chos dbyings bdag nyid can // zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Since he is the nature of the dharmadhatu,

original: 'gro ba'i don dang ldan pa bsgom //
analyzed: 'gro ba'i don dang ldan pa bsgom //
translated: Meditate on him as having the purpose of migrating beings

original: zhes bya ba ni sngon du rnal 'byor pa 'di rnams kyi sna tshogs pa'i bsam pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sngon du rnal 'byor pa 'di rnams kyi sna tshogs pa'i bsam pa ste /
translated: means that previously these yogis and yoginis had various intentions.

original: de'i tshe bsam pas ye shes mtha' med cing thug pa med pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi nang rnams su grangs med pa'i sangs rgyas rnams nam mkha'i khongs su rnam par gnas so //
analyzed: de'i tshe bsam pas ye shes mtha' med cing thug pa med pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi nang rnams su grangs med pa'i sangs rgyas rnams nam mkha'i khongs su rnam par gnas so //
translated: At that time, by the intention, the countless buddhas within the limitless and boundless world systems that are the realm of space are contemplated.

original: de rnams kyis 'chad par 'gyur pa'i bskul bas tshangs pa'i lus su gnas pa'i rdo rje 'chang rab tu sad par byed do //
analyzed: de rnams kyis 'chad par 'gyur pa'i bskul bas tshangs pa'i lus su gnas pa'i rdo rje 'chang rab tu sad par byed do //
translated: By their urging, as will be explained, they awaken Vajradhara, who resides in the body of Brahma.

original: phyis rab tu sad pas ting nge 'dzin dmigs par bya'o zhes bya ste /
analyzed: phyis rab tu sad pas ting nge 'dzin dmigs par bya'o zhes bya ste /
translated: Later, when fully awakened, one should visualize the samƒÅdhi.

original: sngon du 'gro ba 'di rnams thams cad kyi don gyi rgyur rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi ting nge 'dzin la dmigs pa de rnams kyis te /
analyzed: sngon du 'gro ba 'di rnams thams cad kyi don gyi rgyur rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi ting nge 'dzin la dmigs pa de rnams kyis te /
translated: All of these preliminaries are for the purpose of the samƒÅdhi of the yogins and yoginƒ´s that is visualized by them.

original: tsa'i yi ges sngon sna tshogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing rnams su nye bar spyad pa las de'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: tsa'i yi ges sngon sna tshogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing rnams su nye bar spyad pa las de'i rnam pa'o //
translated: The syllable ca is the form of the enjoyment of various buddhafields in the past.

original: kun nas kun du skad cig gis //üîΩzhes bya ba ni dang po sbyor @133a * //
analyzed: kun nas kun du skad cig gis // zhes bya ba ni dang po sbyor @133a * //
translated: All around, all around, in an instant.

original: ba dang dkyil 'khor rgyal po mchog dang las rgyal po mchog dang thig le'i rnal 'byor dang phra mo'i rnal 'byor thams cad rdzogs par bya ba'o //
analyzed: ba dang dkyil 'khor rgyal po mchog dang las rgyal po mchog dang thig le'i rnal 'byor dang phra mo'i rnal 'byor thams cad rdzogs par bya ba'o //
translated: This is the first application, the supreme ma·πá·∏çala king, the supreme karma king, and the bindu yoga and subtle yoga, all of which are to be perfected.

original: kun zhes bya ba ni thig le bzhi'i rang bzhin gyi don te /
analyzed: kun zhes bya ba ni thig le bzhi'i rang bzhin gyi don te /
translated: All means the meaning of the nature of the four bindus.

original: de ltar yang thig le bzhi gsungs pa /
analyzed: de ltar yang thig le bzhi gsungs pa /
translated: Thus, the four bindus are stated:

original: shr'i yig ces bya ba la sogs pas te /
analyzed: shr'i yig ces bya ba la sogs pas te /
translated: The syllable ≈õrƒ´, and so on.

original: 'byung ba kun gyi don zhes bya ba ni phyi rol dus la sogs pa dkyil 'khor 'byung ba'i don dang khams gsum mo //
analyzed: 'byung ba kun gyi don zhes bya ba ni phyi rol dus la sogs pa dkyil 'khor 'byung ba'i don dang khams gsum mo //
translated: The meaning of all the elements is the meaning of the arising of the external mandala of time, etc., and the three realms.

original: nang gi bdag nyid ces bya ba ni sa la sogs pa'i khams kyi rang bzhin gyi lus kyang ngo //
analyzed: nang gi bdag nyid ces bya ba ni sa la sogs pa'i khams kyi rang bzhin gyi lus kyang ngo //
translated: The internal nature is the body whose nature is the elements of earth, etc.

original: de 'dod pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de 'dod pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: That is asserted.

original: 'di gnyis kun rdzob kyi gzugs can zhes bya bar 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: 'di gnyis kun rdzob kyi gzugs can zhes bya bar 'dod pa'o //
translated: These two are asserted to have the nature of conventional form.

original: 'jug pa med pa ni don dam pa'o //
analyzed: 'jug pa med pa ni don dam pa'o //
translated: The non-entry is the ultimate.

original: tsa'i yi ges 'dod pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: tsa'i yi ges 'dod pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The syllable tsa is asserted.

original: de yang bde ba'i mtha' can gang //
analyzed: de yang bde ba'i mtha' can gang //
translated: That also is the end of bliss.

original: zhes bya ba ni lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'i mthar lhung ba med pa bral ba ji srid pa ste bar ma'i bde ba brjod du med pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'i mthar lhung ba med pa bral ba ji srid pa ste bar ma'i bde ba brjod du med pa'o //
translated: The end of co-emergent joy is the end of non-separation, which is inexpressible intermediate bliss.

original: 'di la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni mtha' med cing thug pa med pa'i chos dang chos nyis mtshan nyid kyis gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: 'di la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni mtha' med cing thug pa med pa'i chos dang chos nyis mtshan nyid kyis gsungs pa ste /
translated: This and so forth is the teaching of the characteristics of phenomena and non-phenomena that are endless and limitless.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis thams dang shes rab kyi bdag nyid can gyi chos kyis kyang ngo //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis thams dang shes rab kyi bdag nyid can gyi chos kyis kyang ngo //

original: de thams cad gnyis su med pas kyang shr'i'i yi ge nye bar bstan pas so //
analyzed: de thams cad gnyis su med pas kyang shr'i'i yi ge nye bar bstan pas so //
translated: All of that is non-dual, and is indicated by the syllable A.

original: de brjod pa zhes bya ba ni ye ge'i rnam pa sna tshogs pa brjod pa'i po tir bshad pa ste yongs su bzhag pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de brjod pa zhes bya ba ni ye ge'i rnam pa sna tshogs pa brjod pa'i po tir bshad pa ste yongs su bzhag pa zhes bya ba'o //

original: thig le dang po ste 'dis dang po'i sbyor ba thams cad thos pa dang bsam pa la sogs pa sngon du rjes su dran pa'i tshogs gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: thig le dang po ste 'dis dang po'i sbyor ba thams cad thos pa dang bsam pa la sogs pa sngon du rjes su dran pa'i tshogs gsungs pa'o //

analyzed: de ltar thig le gnyis pa dang bo'i sbyor ba de nyid kyi tshogs gsungs pa /
translated: Thus, the second drop. By that, the first application is stated, the recollection of the accumulation.

original: he yig ces bya ba la sogs pa ste snying ga nas kun du zhes bya ba ni thos pa dang bsam pa'i dus su yang mi 'dod pa ma yin te ye shes 'ongs spyod rdzogs pa'i bdag nyid can snying ga nas rang gi sems mi gtong pa'o //
analyzed: he yig ces bya ba la sogs pa ste snying ga nas kun du zhes bya ba ni thos pa dang bsam pa'i dus su yang mi 'dod pa ma yin te ye shes 'ongs spyod rdzogs pa'i bdag nyid can snying ga nas rang gi sems mi gtong pa'o //
translated: The he and so on means that from the heart, everywhere means that it is not undesirable even at the time of hearing and reflection, and that the wisdom being, who is of the nature of the enjoyment body, does not abandon one's mind from the heart.

original: de yang he ru ka la sogs //
analyzed: de yang he ru ka la sogs //

original: zhes bya ba ni sna tshogs pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo'i bdag nyid can no //

analyzed: rang gi 'khor lor son zhes bya ba ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i bdag nyid kyi 'khor lo ste nam mkha' la gnas pa'i he ru ka la sogs pa sna tshogs pa'i rdo rje 'chang @133b gi gzugs de rnams kyi nang du 'di gzhag pa ste skyed pa po

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //

original: stong pa'i bdag nyid can yang zhes bya ba ni 'dzin pa po la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor kyi  'khor lo rgyus stong pa'o //
analyzed: stong pa'i bdag nyid can yang zhes bya ba ni 'dzin pa po la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor kyi  'khor lo rgyus stong pa'o //
translated: The empty nature means that the ma·πá·∏çala wheel of the apprehender and so on is empty of intrinsic reality.

original: de'i phyir rgyu med pa la sogs pa nyid kyis brtags pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir rgyu med pa la sogs pa nyid kyis brtags pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is imagined by causelessness, etc.

analyzed: stong pa'i rgyu thams cad kyis mi 'dod pa'i rgyu zhes bya ba'i don to //

original: rnal 'byor rnams kyi sbyor gnas pa //
analyzed: rnal 'byor rnams kyi sbyor gnas pa //
translated: The yoga practitioners‚Äô application is

translated: This is the second drop, the second assembly.

original: de bzhin du gsum pa'i thig le gsum la sogs pa dang po sbyor ba'i yongs su byed pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: de bzhin du gsum pa'i thig le gsum la sogs pa dang po sbyor ba'i yongs su byed pa gsungs pa /

translated: ‚Äúarray,‚Äù etc. That which is thoroughly understood at the time of hearing, reflection, etc.

analyzed: de nyid gang zag gi bdag med pa sprul pa can gyi sku'o //
translated: That itself is the person‚Äôs selflessness, the emanation body.

analyzed: sna tshogs pa'i chos 'chad pa la sogs pa'i rtog pa'i dra ba rnam par spro'o //

analyzed: mi 'dod min pas chen po zhes bya ba ni mkhas pa rnams kyi nges pa'o //

original: de'i don gsungs pa /
analyzed: de'i don gsungs pa /

analyzed: ru yig rkyen gyi bdag nyid de //

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /

analyzed: ru yig bkod pa dang bral ba //

original: zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste /

analyzed: lung gi nang du gsungs pas de'i rkyen gyis longs spyod rdzogs pa dang chos dang sprul ba'i sku la de'i bkod pa dang bral ba zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i rnam par rtog pa las ring du byas pas yid la 'dod pas byung ba rnams
translated: By the statement in the scriptures, by that condition, the sa·πÉbhogakƒÅya, dharmakƒÅya, and nirmƒÅ·πáakƒÅya are called free from its arrangement. Since it is far removed from the concepts of relative truth, it is beyond the concepts of those who arise from mental desire.

original: kyi rnam par rtog pa tsam kyang med pa ste /
analyzed: kyi rnam par rtog pa tsam kyang med pa ste /

original: bdag gis zhes bya ba ni de dang 'dra ba'i ste sh'a kya thub pa la sogs pa rnams kyi chos dang longs spyod rdzogs pa dang sprul pa'i bdag nyid can rnams kyi sangs rgyas rnams kyang ngo //
analyzed: bdag gis zhes bya ba ni de dang 'dra ba'i ste sh'a kya thub pa la sogs pa rnams kyi chos dang longs spyod rdzogs pa dang sprul pa'i bdag nyid can rnams kyi sangs rgyas rnams kyang ngo //

analyzed: de'i phyir rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes de sangs rgyas kyi zag pa med pa nyon mongs pa med pa phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: Therefore, that nonconceptual intuition is the characteristic of the Buddha‚Äôs uncontaminated, unaddicted, residual-free nirvana.

original: de lta bu'i rkyen gyi yi ge'o //
analyzed: de lta bu'i rkyen gyi yi ge'o //

original: sangs rgyas kyi kun rdzob kyi yi ge rnams su ye shes ma yin te @134a * //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi kun rdzob kyi yi ge rnams su ye shes ma yin te @134a * //
translated: The Buddhas‚Äô conventional letters are not intuition,

analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi ming dngos po'i 'du shes bdag gi 'du shes zhes bya ba cung zad yong pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'o //
