original: thig le gsum pa dang yongs su bcad pa gsum pa'o //
analyzed: thig le gsum pa dang yongs su bcad pa gsum pa'o //
translated: This is the third drop and the third section.

original: thig le bzhi pa dang rnal 'byor chen po'i yongs su byed pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: thig le bzhi pa dang rnal 'byor chen po'i yongs su byed pa gsungs pa /
translated: The fourth drop and the great yoga‚Äôs section on performance are taught.

original: ka slar zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: ka slar zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The again and so on.

original: 'dir sngon du 'di rnams rnal 'byor pa 'di rnams kyis thos pa dang bsam pa la sogs pa'i dus su chos bdag med pa'i mtshan nyid du thams cad 'gro ste /
analyzed: 'dir sngon du 'di rnams rnal 'byor pa 'di rnams kyis thos pa dang bsam pa la sogs pa'i dus su chos bdag med pa'i mtshan nyid du thams cad 'gro ste /
translated: Here, previously, at the time of hearing, contemplating, and so on, all of these yogas go to the characteristic of the objective selflessness.

original: de ltar rang nyid chos kyi sku'o //
analyzed: de ltar rang nyid chos kyi sku'o //
translated: Thus, one is the dharmakƒÅya.

original: chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin gyi mtshan nyid kyi phyir ma lus pa rtsod pa med pa sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rigs so //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin gyi mtshan nyid kyi phyir ma lus pa rtsod pa med pa sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rigs so //
translated: Because of the characteristic of the nature of all phenomena, without exception, the non-disputed buddha and bodhisattvas are the family.

original: ci slar yang gzhan yod pa bdag gis 'di lta bu'i ye shes rnams kyis gnyis su med pa rnams su gang gzhan gyi rigs pa ma mthong ste /
analyzed: ci slar yang gzhan yod pa bdag gis 'di lta bu'i ye shes rnams kyis gnyis su med pa rnams su gang gzhan gyi rigs pa ma mthong ste /
translated: What is the other existence? I do not see any other family of nonduality with these kinds of wisdoms.

original: gang gi phyir de'i tshe rtsa'i yi ge gnyis su med pa'i ye shes rang nyid sangs rgyas kyang gang na yang cung zad gnas pa med ces bya ste chos kyi sku spang pa'am gzhan gyi rigs la thim pa ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de'i tshe rtsa'i yi ge gnyis su med pa'i ye shes rang nyid sangs rgyas kyang gang na yang cung zad gnas pa med ces bya ste chos kyi sku spang pa'am gzhan gyi rigs la thim pa ste /
translated: Therefore, at that time, the nondual wisdom of the nƒÅ·∏çƒ´s is the buddha, but it does not abide anywhere at all.

original: dbang phyug gi lta bar rigs dang rigs las byung ba brjod pa dang skye ba dang por gnas so //
analyzed: dbang phyug gi lta bar rigs dang rigs las byung ba brjod pa dang skye ba dang por gnas so //
translated: The theory of ƒ™≈õvara is refuted by the statement that the universal and the particular are not tenable, and that the first birth is not tenable.

original: de'i phyir gang gi tshe de rnams kyi rigs pa ma yin te lus ni rigs yin la ye shes ni rigs las byung zhes te rigs rnams la brten pas ni rigs las byung ba'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir gang gi tshe de rnams kyi rigs pa ma yin te lus ni rigs yin la ye shes ni rigs las byung zhes te rigs rnams la brten pas ni rigs las byung ba'o //
translated: Therefore, when the universal and the particular are not tenable, the body is the universal and consciousness is the particular, because they are based on the universals, they are the particulars.

original: de nyid rigs dang rigs can zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de nyid rigs dang rigs can zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: That itself is the meaning of the universal and the particular.

original: de ltar gnyis po dag med par grub ste gang gi tshe yang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i nges par dpyad pa med do //
analyzed: de ltar gnyis po dag med par grub ste gang gi tshe yang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i nges par dpyad pa med do //
translated: Thus, the two are established as non-existent, because there is no analysis of the certainty of cause and effect.

original: 'bras bu'i dngos po la rgyu yod na s'a lu la sogs pa'i sa bon kyang ngo //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i dngos po la rgyu yod na s'a lu la sogs pa'i sa bon kyang ngo //
translated: If the effect exists in the cause, then even the seed of rice, etc. would be the effect.

original: de ltar gal te rgyu med na 'bras bu ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar gal te rgyu med na 'bras bu ji ltar zhe na /
translated: Thus, if there is no cause, how can there be an effect?

original: de la sogs pas rgyu'i dngos po la rnam par dpyod pa med do //
analyzed: de la sogs pas rgyu'i dngos po la rnam par dpyod pa med do //
translated: Therefore, there is no analysis of the nature of the cause.

original: gal te yang rigs las byung ba la rigs la brten pa de'i tshe ji ltar bshad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: gal te yang rigs las byung ba la rigs la brten pa de'i tshe ji ltar bshad pa bzhin no //
translated: And if the particular exists in the universal, then it is as explained.

original: de ltar gang gi phyir ka'i yi ges gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar gang gi phyir ka'i yi ges gsungs pa ste /
translated: Thus, because of the syllable ka,

original: sangs rgyas dang sangs rgyas kyi ye shes kyang gang na yang gnas pa med do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang sangs rgyas kyi ye shes kyang gang na yang gnas pa med do //
translated: the Buddha and the Buddha's gnosis are not located anywhere.

original: de ji ltar byang chub ce na /
analyzed: de ji ltar byang chub ce na /
translated: How is that enlightened?

original: thams cad mi bden pa'i sku thams cad kyi mtshan nyid kyi phyir byang chub ces bya'o //
analyzed: thams cad mi bden pa'i sku thams cad kyi mtshan nyid kyi phyir byang chub ces bya'o //
translated: It is called enlightenment because of the characteristic of the body of all that is not true.

original: @134b de yang bsgom pa dang yid kyis gzung ba'i dngos po yang mi bden pa'o //
analyzed: @134b de yang bsgom pa dang yid kyis gzung ba'i dngos po yang mi bden pa'o //
translated: Moreover, the object of meditation and mental apprehension is also not true.

original: de'i dngos po yang stong pa ste gong bu rdul phra rab kyi dbye bas rnam par dpyad par gyur pas bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa chos kyi sku'i gzugs so //
analyzed: de'i dngos po yang stong pa ste gong bu rdul phra rab kyi dbye bas rnam par dpyad par gyur pas bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa chos kyi sku'i gzugs so //
translated: That thing is also empty, because the aggregate is analyzed by the division of the subtle particle. The form of the Dharma Body is like a pot, a cloth, and so on.

original: de yang bstan pa'i rab tu bcings pas chos kyi sku mngon par brjod pa'i 'du shes tsam mo //
analyzed: de yang bstan pa'i rab tu bcings pas chos kyi sku mngon par brjod pa'i 'du shes tsam mo //

original: dngos med mngon sum stong pa nyid //
analyzed: dngos med mngon sum stong pa nyid //
translated: The non-entity is the direct perception of emptiness.

original: ces bya ba ni 'di ni sgyu ma dang rmi lam dang dbang po'i dra ba'i rang bzhin khams gsum gyi dngos po rab tu gsal ba tsam stong pa ma yin pa gzung ba med pas dngos po tsam gyi rang bzhin can no //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni 'di ni sgyu ma dang rmi lam dang dbang po'i dra ba'i rang bzhin khams gsum gyi dngos po rab tu gsal ba tsam stong pa ma yin pa gzung ba med pas dngos po tsam gyi rang bzhin can no //
translated: This is the nature of the illusion, dream, and sense-web, the mere clarity of the entities of the three realms, not empty, having the nature of mere entities, because of the non-existence of the apprehended.

original: gang gi phyir mi 'dod pa ma yin na thog ma med pa'i dus kyi rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis ye shes kyis bskyed pa'i dngos po thams cad do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir mi 'dod pa ma yin na thog ma med pa'i dus kyi rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis ye shes kyis bskyed pa'i dngos po thams cad do //
translated: Since it is not undesirable, it is all entities generated by the pristine consciousness of the yogins of beginningless time.

original: 'di yis dpal he ru ka'i go 'phang zhes bya ba ni sngon du bshad pa'i thig le bzhi'i yongs su 'dzin pa po'i gnas kyi nges pas so //
analyzed: 'di yis dpal he ru ka'i go 'phang zhes bya ba ni sngon du bshad pa'i thig le bzhi'i yongs su 'dzin pa po'i gnas kyi nges pas so //
translated: This is the state of ≈örƒ´ Heruka, which is the ascertainment of the location of the possessor of the four bindus explained previously.

analyzed: 'di rnams kyi rgyu gsungs pa lha mo bsgom pa thams cad sngon du song bas zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The cause of these is stated: ‚ÄúHaving previously meditated on the goddess.‚Äù

original: rdo rje phag mo la sogs pa bsgom pa byas pas de thams cad du 'gro ba ste 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du rab tu 'jug pa sngon du ste thog mar bskyed pa'o//
analyzed: rdo rje phag mo la sogs pa bsgom pa byas pas de thams cad du 'gro ba ste 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du rab tu 'jug pa sngon du ste thog mar bskyed pa'o//
translated: Having performed the meditation of VajravƒÅrƒÅhƒ´, etc., all of that is pervaded, i.e., all world systems are pervaded, by the prior, i.e., first, generation.

original: 'di ni thig le dang tshogs byed pa bzhi ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni thig le dang tshogs byed pa bzhi ba'o //
translated: This is the fourth drop and assembly.

original: de ltar rab tu rgyas pa yod pas tshangs pa rdo rje 'chang skad cig gis thams cad sngon bsgoms pa'i bag chags kyis gsal bar byas pa thig le bzhi'i rang bzhin dran pas mthong pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar rab tu rgyas pa yod pas tshangs pa rdo rje 'chang skad cig gis thams cad sngon bsgoms pa'i bag chags kyis gsal bar byas pa thig le bzhi'i rang bzhin dran pas mthong pa'o //
translated: Thus, since there is a pervasion, BrahmƒÅ Vajradhara is instantly clarified by the latent tendencies of all previous meditations, and is seen by the recollection of the nature of the four drops.

analyzed: de ltar bsgom pa'i nang du thig le bzhi sngon du rgyu nyid kyi phyir ro //

analyzed: de ltar thig le bzhi'i nang du bsgom pa'o //

original: de'i phyir thig le bzhi'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir thig le bzhi'o //

original: gang gi phyir de dran pas bsgom pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de dran pas bsgom pa'i phyir ro //

original: de ltar de'i bsgom pa la sogs pa'i rnal 'byor gsungs pa /
analyzed: de ltar de'i bsgom pa la sogs pa'i rnal 'byor gsungs pa /
translated: Thus, the yoga of that meditation, etc., is stated:

analyzed: snying ga'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /

analyzed: rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis snying gis te rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis snying gar nyi ma dang chu skyes kyi dbus su bsgom par bya'o //

analyzed: rang byung la sogs zhes bya ba ni ji ltar 'ga' zhig tu yang rab tu 'bar bar song ba yod pa @135a * //
translated: Self-arisen, etc. means that just as in some places the fire that has gone out is

original: ni sdong bu dang me tsam gyis slar yang 'bar ro //
analyzed: ni sdong bu dang me tsam gyis slar yang 'bar ro //
translated: rekindled by the mere presence of the fuel and the fire,

original: de bzhin du dga' ba dang bcas pa'i sems kyi bde ba tsam gang yin pa de sems kyis bon te ye shes kyi rnam pa las byung bas rang byung zhes bya ba ste thig le bzhi bsdus pa de'i gzugs zhes bya ba'i don to //

analyzed: de ltar yang rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis bsgom pa'i dus rnams su yongs su gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pas rgyu'i rdo rje 'chang rang dang 'dra ba'i shes rab dang thabs kyi lhan cig tu zhu bar gyur nas sa bon du gyur pa'i gnas skabs su gyur
translated: Thus, the yogis and yoginis, at the time of meditation, completely transform, etc. The causal Vajradhara, similar to oneself, melts together with the wisdom and means, and becomes the state of the seed syllable.

original: to // des de ltar rdzogs pa ni dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo gtso bo'i dkyil 'khor pa rnams kyis lhan cig bzhis lhag pa'i lnga brgya'i bdag nyid can bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba ste 'char par 'gyur ba'i 'bras bu'i rdo rje 'chang ngo //
analyzed: to // des de ltar rdzogs pa ni dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo gtso bo'i dkyil 'khor pa rnams kyis lhan cig bzhis lhag pa'i lnga brgya'i bdag nyid can bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba ste 'char par 'gyur ba'i 'bras bu'i rdo rje 'chang ngo //
translated: Thus, the perfection is the result Vajradhara, who is to be meditated on by the mandala circle, the principal and the mandala members, with the nature of five hundred and four.

original: rdzogs pa zhes bya ba ni de'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can gyi 'jig rten bskyed par ri rab kyi steng du tshangs ba la sogs pa rtsen pa'i sbyor bas 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: rdzogs pa zhes bya ba ni de'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can gyi 'jig rten bskyed par ri rab kyi steng du tshangs ba la sogs pa rtsen pa'i sbyor bas 'jug pa'o //
translated: The word perfected means that the world of sentient beings in his world-realm is generated, and that he enters into the enjoyment of the play of Brahma and so forth on top of Mount Meru.

original: sa gzhi'i mthil du yang zhes bya ba ni sngon du bshad pa'i bdud rtsi la sogs pa rnams kyis mchod pa byas nas de bzhin du lang sngon gyi lha bshos dbul ba'i sa'i steng du bdud rtsi zhu ba'i gzugs kyis rnams par gnas pa'o //
analyzed: sa gzhi'i mthil du yang zhes bya ba ni sngon du bshad pa'i bdud rtsi la sogs pa rnams kyis mchod pa byas nas de bzhin du lang sngon gyi lha bshos dbul ba'i sa'i steng du bdud rtsi zhu ba'i gzugs kyis rnams par gnas pa'o //
translated: And on the surface of the ground means that after making offerings with the nectar and so forth explained previously, in the same way, the blue-colored food offering is offered, and he abides in the form of melted nectar on the surface of the ground.

original: de'i bdud rtsi myang bas lha de nam mkha'i rang bzhin ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i bdud rtsi myang bas lha de nam mkha'i rang bzhin ma yin no //
translated: By tasting that nectar, the gods are not of the nature of space.

original: der de ltar bdud rtsi'i dbus su rab tu zhugs par gyur to //
analyzed: der de ltar bdud rtsi'i dbus su rab tu zhugs par gyur to //
translated: In that way, he enters into the middle of the nectar.

original: rang gi 'od mi snang bar song ba rnams sems med par rnam par gnas so //
analyzed: rang gi 'od mi snang bar song ba rnams sems med par rnam par gnas so //
translated: Those who have gone to the disappearance of their own light abide without mind.

original: slar yang rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi rnam par shes pa rgyu'i rdo rje 'chang yongs su gyur pa yod pas dkyil 'khor pa thams cad kyis kyang stong pa nyid kyi gzugs su gyur to //
analyzed: slar yang rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi rnam par shes pa rgyu'i rdo rje 'chang yongs su gyur pa yod pas dkyil 'khor pa thams cad kyis kyang stong pa nyid kyi gzugs su gyur to //
translated: Again, since the consciousness of the yogis is the cause Vajradhara, all of the mandala also become the form of emptiness.

original: de rnams kyis kyang glu rnams kyis rtag tu zhes bya ba ni snying rje dang / byams pa dang / dga' ba dang / btang snyoms kyi rang bzhin gyi rnal 'byor ma rnams kyis sngon gyi smon lam gyi dbang gis rab tu sad par byed do //
analyzed: de rnams kyis kyang glu rnams kyis rtag tu zhes bya ba ni snying rje dang / byams pa dang / dga' ba dang / btang snyoms kyi rang bzhin gyi rnal 'byor ma rnams kyis sngon gyi smon lam gyi dbang gis rab tu sad par byed do //
translated: Those also, with the songs, always, means that the yoginis, who are the nature of compassion, love, joy, and equanimity, are awakened by the power of former prayers.

original: glu de gsungs pa /
analyzed: glu de gsungs pa /
translated: Those songs are stated:

original: 'gro ba mgron 'bod @137a * //
analyzed: 'gro ba mgron 'bod @137a * //
translated: Inviting the guests of the world,

original: ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: and so forth.

original: rkang pa bzhi pa'i tshigs su bcad pa bzhi rnams kyis te /
analyzed: rkang pa bzhi pa'i tshigs su bcad pa bzhi rnams kyis te /
translated: With the four verses of four lines,

original: khyab bdag nyi ma re rer 'gro ba mgron 'bod na //
analyzed: khyab bdag nyi ma re rer 'gro ba mgron 'bod na //
translated: The lord of the world invites the world every day.

original: zhes bya ba ni kye khyab bdag 'gro ba snying rje'i ros khyod kyis mgron du pos pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni kye khyab bdag 'gro ba snying rje'i ros khyod kyis mgron du pos pa ste /
translated: Inviting the guests of the world means, O lord of the world, you invite the world with the taste of compassion.

original: khyod ni ci'i phyir stong pa nyid du bzhugs zhes bya ba ste ci'i don du khyod stong pa nyid la rab tu zhugs par gyur /
analyzed: khyod ni ci'i phyir stong pa nyid du bzhugs zhes bya ba ste ci'i don du khyod stong pa nyid la rab tu zhugs par gyur /
translated: For what purpose have you entered into emptiness?üîΩTherefore, arise, we are compassionate by nature,

original: de'i phyir bzhengs shig bdag ni snying rje'i rang bzhin te zhes bya ba ni bzhengs shig stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin spongs la bdag bdag cag snying rje'i rang bzhin can ma rnams kyis sems can gyi don mdzod cig /
analyzed: de'i phyir bzhengs shig bdag ni snying rje'i rang bzhin te zhes bya ba ni bzhengs shig stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin spongs la bdag bdag cag snying rje'i rang bzhin can ma rnams kyis sems can gyi don mdzod cig /
translated: that is, arise, abandon the meditative stabilization of emptiness, and act for the welfare of sentient beings, we who are compassionate by nature.üîΩWhat is that?

original: pa'o // ci de nyid gsungs pa /
analyzed: pa'o // ci de nyid gsungs pa /
translated: He says:

original: bde ba chen po'i rdo rjes bdag la 'dod pa mdzod //üîΩces bya ba ste /
analyzed: bde ba chen po'i rdo rjes bdag la 'dod pa mdzod // ces bya ba ste /
translated: The great bliss vajra should enjoy me.

original: bde ba chen po'i kye mgon po rdo rje 'chang mchog tu zag pa med pa'i sbyor ba dang ldan pas bdag la 'dod pa gyis rol par gyis te rang gi 'dod pa rdzogs par mdzod ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bde ba chen po'i kye mgon po rdo rje 'chang mchog tu zag pa med pa'i sbyor ba dang ldan pas bdag la 'dod pa gyis rol par gyis te rang gi 'dod pa rdzogs par mdzod ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The great bliss, O protector, Vajradhara, should enjoy me, should play with me, with the supreme uncontaminated union, should fulfill my desires.

original: slar yang gsungs pa /
analyzed: slar yang gsungs pa /
translated: Again he says:

original: gson cig gson cig gzhan gyi dgos pa nub //
analyzed: gson cig gson cig gzhan gyi dgos pa nub //
translated: Listen, listen, the purpose of others is lost.

original: ces bya ba ni kye khyab bdag cag snying rje'i rang bzhin can ma rnams kyi bdag gson cig khyod kyis gcig tu na stong pa nyid la zhugs pa tsam ma yin gyi gzhan rnams khams gsum gyi sems can rnams kyi dgos pa nub pa ste byams pa med
analyzed: ces bya ba ni kye khyab bdag cag snying rje'i rang bzhin can ma rnams kyi bdag gson cig khyod kyis gcig tu na stong pa nyid la zhugs pa tsam ma yin gyi gzhan rnams khams gsum gyi sems can rnams kyi dgos pa nub pa ste byams pa med
translated: You are not only engaged in emptiness, but also the need of others, the sentient beings of the three realms, is not fulfilled, because of the absence of love.

original: pa nyid kyi phyir sdang ba'i byams pa rnams skye'o zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: pa nyid kyi phyir sdang ba'i byams pa rnams skye'o zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, the angry ones are born.

original: 'jig rten phyugs rnams shi ba bzhin du song //
analyzed: 'jig rten phyugs rnams shi ba bzhin du song //
translated: The world has gone like the death of cattle.

original: zhes bya ba ni sdang ba'i byams pa gang gis 'jig rten gyi phyugs la rnam par ma dpyad pas 'chi ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sdang ba'i byams pa gang gis 'jig rten gyi phyugs la rnam par ma dpyad pas 'chi ba'o //
translated: The angry ones are born, and the world has gone like the death of cattle, because of not investigating.

original: slar yang dmyal ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal nyams su myong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: slar yang dmyal ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal nyams su myong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Again, one will experience the suffering of the hells and so forth.

original: de'i phyir nga'i ngag la nyon la stong pa nyid spongs shig pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir nga'i ngag la nyon la stong pa nyid spongs shig pa'o //
translated: Therefore, listen to my words and abandon emptiness!

original: des ci bya ba gsungs pa /
analyzed: des ci bya ba gsungs pa /
translated: What is to be done by that? He says:

original: bdag gi padma rgyas pa la 'dod mdzod //üîΩces bya ba ste /
analyzed: bdag gi padma rgyas pa la 'dod mdzod //üîΩces bya ba ste /
translated: On my blooming lotus, make love!

original: bdag gi shin tu kha bye ba rgya che ba lhan cig skyes pa'i rang bzhin gyi padma byams pa'i ro'i gzugs de khyod kyis 'dod pa gyis shig / gang gis 'dod pa byas pas de ltar 'jig rten kun ni bde 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag gi shin tu kha bye ba rgya che ba lhan cig skyes pa'i rang bzhin gyi padma byams pa'i ro'i gzugs de khyod kyis 'dod pa gyis shig / gang gis 'dod pa byas pas de ltar 'jig rten kun ni bde 'gyur ro //
translated: By whom desire is made, thus all the world will be happy.

original: zhes bya ba ni de'i tshe 'jig rten 'di rnams thams cad kyi bde bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni de'i tshe 'jig rten 'di rnams thams cad kyi bde bar 'gyur ro //
translated: This is: at that time all these worlds will be happy.

original: de rnams kyang mi @137b 'chi'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyang mi @137b 'chi'o //
translated: And they will not die.

original: dmyal ba la sogs par 'gro bar mi byed do //
analyzed: dmyal ba la sogs par 'gro bar mi byed do //
translated: They will not go to hell and so forth.

original: lam gyi yang rgyur 'gro'o //
analyzed: lam gyi yang rgyur 'gro'o //
translated: And they will become the cause of the path.

original: slar yang gzhan gsungs pa /
analyzed: slar yang gzhan gsungs pa /
translated: Again, he says something else:

original: rdo rje 'dzin pas bdag la rol cig rol //
analyzed: rdo rje 'dzin pas bdag la rol cig rol //
translated: Play with me, O Vajra Holder, play!

original: zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste /
translated: This is:

original: kye bya ba bdag rdo rje 'chang bdag cag rab tu dga' ba'i rang bzhin ma rnams la rol pa dang rtsen pa gyis shig stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin spongs shig pa'o //
analyzed: kye bya ba bdag rdo rje 'chang bdag cag rab tu dga' ba'i rang bzhin ma rnams la rol pa dang rtsen pa gyis shig stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin spongs shig pa'o //
translated: O Vajradhara, play with us, the nature of great joy, and abandon the emptiness samadhi.

original: lhan skyes rang bzhin brjod du med pa 'thob //
analyzed: lhan skyes rang bzhin brjod du med pa 'thob //
translated: The innate nature is inexpressible, and is attained.

original: ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: ces bya ba ni /
translated: This is:

original: gang gis stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin spang pa yod pas brjod du med pa'i lhan cig skyes pa'i rang bzhin gyi bde ba 'thob pa ste des sems can rnams kyi rab tu dga' bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gis stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin spang pa yod pas brjod du med pa'i lhan cig skyes pa'i rang bzhin gyi bde ba 'thob pa ste des sems can rnams kyi rab tu dga' bar 'gyur ro //
translated: By whom the emptiness samƒÅdhi is abandoned, there is the attainment of the inexpressible innate nature of bliss, and by that, sentient beings will be delighted.

original: 'on kyang 'jig rten sems can gzhan ni rmongs gyur pas //
analyzed: 'on kyang 'jig rten sems can gzhan ni rmongs gyur pas //
translated: However, other worldly sentient beings are deluded.

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This is said:

original: gcig tu na khyod kyis rab tu dga' ba dang bral bas 'jig rten pa thams cad bkug cing mgron du bos pa yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gcig tu na khyod kyis rab tu dga' ba dang bral bas 'jig rten pa thams cad bkug cing mgron du bos pa yod pa ma yin te /
translated: In one way, all worldly people are not invited and welcomed by you due to being separated from delight.

original: byang chub kyi yul de'i tshe gzhan gnyis pa nyid du 'gyur te //
analyzed: byang chub kyi yul de'i tshe gzhan gnyis pa nyid du 'gyur te //
translated: At that time, there would be a second object of enlightenment.

original: des sems can gyi don mi 'grub po //
analyzed: des sems can gyi don mi 'grub po //
translated: By that, the welfare of sentient beings is not accomplished.

original: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lam las 'das par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lam las 'das par 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, it would be beyond the path of the bodhisattvas.

original: de gsungs pa /
analyzed: de gsungs pa /
translated: That is said:

original: ji ltar khyod kyi stong nyid don med do //
analyzed: ji ltar khyod kyi stong nyid don med do //
translated: How is your emptiness meaningless?

original: zhes bya ba ste rgyu mtshan gang gis stong pa nyid dgos pa med pa la khyod kyis rab tu zhugs pas de de bzhin du bshad do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste rgyu mtshan gang gis stong pa nyid dgos pa med pa la khyod kyis rab tu zhugs pas de de bzhin du bshad do //
translated: Thus, since you have entered into emptiness without purpose, it is explained just as it is.

original: de'i phyir stong pa nyid dor la bdag gi mchog gi bde ba bla na med pa rab tu dga' ba'i bde pas 'dod pa gyis shig mnyam pa med pa'i sems can gyi khams rab tu dga' ba'i ye shes 'thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de'i phyir stong pa nyid dor la bdag gi mchog gi bde ba bla na med pa rab tu dga' ba'i bde pas 'dod pa gyis shig mnyam pa med pa'i sems can gyi khams rab tu dga' ba'i ye shes 'thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Therefore, give up emptiness and enjoy the supreme bliss of self, the bliss of supreme joy, and you will attain the unsurpassed, unequaled wisdom of the realm of sentient beings.

original: de bzhin du gzhan yang gsungs pa /
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan yang gsungs pa /
translated: Thus, it is also said elsewhere:

original: khyod ni chos thams cad kyi byed pa ste //
analyzed: khyod ni chos thams cad kyi byed pa ste //
translated: You are the agent of all phenomena.

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This is saying,

original: kye khyab bdag khyed ni chos thams cad kyi byed pa sems can gyi don bskyed pa rnams te /
analyzed: kye khyab bdag khyed ni chos thams cad kyi byed pa sems can gyi don bskyed pa rnams te /
translated: ‚ÄúOh, all-pervading lord, you are the agent of all phenomena, the one who generates the welfare of sentient beings.

original: de'i tshe ci'i phyir stong pa nyid rang bzhin son par bzhugs zhes bya ba ste cis khyod lhan cig skyes pa'i rang bzhin gzungs pas des ma bzhud cig stong pa nyid du zhugs pa dor cig / de'i tshe yang bdag la mchog gi don gyis dgyes pa mdzod
analyzed: de'i tshe ci'i phyir stong pa nyid rang bzhin son par bzhugs zhes bya ba ste cis khyod lhan cig skyes pa'i rang bzhin gzungs pas des ma bzhud cig stong pa nyid du zhugs pa dor cig / de'i tshe yang bdag la mchog gi don gyis dgyes pa mdzod
translated: At that time, also, be pleased with me by the supreme meaning.

original: ces bya ba ste bdag 'jig rten gyi chos brgyad rnams la btang snyoms pa ste @138a * //
analyzed: ces bya ba ste bdag 'jig rten gyi chos brgyad rnams la btang snyoms pa ste @138a * //
translated: This is the equanimity of the self with regard to the eight worldly dharmas.

original: 'on kyang snying rje'i rang bzhin can ma rnams la mchog gi don gyi bde bas 'dod pa gyis shig pa'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang snying rje'i rang bzhin can ma rnams la mchog gi don gyi bde bas 'dod pa gyis shig pa'o //
translated: Nevertheless, be pleased by the bliss of the supreme meaning with regard to the women who are of the nature of compassion.

original: ji ltar khyod ni 'jig rten dang mnyam 'gro //
analyzed: ji ltar khyod ni 'jig rten dang mnyam 'gro //
translated: How is it that you are equal to the world?üîΩThis is the performance of desire by the bliss of benefiting others.

original: zhes bya ba ni gang gis don byed pa'i bde bas 'dod pa byas pha dang khyod kyis gzigs pas 'jig rten khyod dang mnyam par rab tu 'gro'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gang gis don byed pa'i bde bas 'dod pa byas pha dang khyod kyis gzigs pas 'jig rten khyod dang mnyam par rab tu 'gro'o //
translated: By your vision, the world is equal to you.

original: byang chub kyi rang bzhin gyis kyang ngo //
analyzed: byang chub kyi rang bzhin gyis kyang ngo //
translated: Also, by the nature of enlightenment.

original: de'i tshe phan tshun sems can gyi don byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de'i tshe phan tshun sems can gyi don byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: At that time, they act for the sake of sentient beings, one another.üîΩThis is the meaning of the verse beginning with at that time.

original: 'di zhes bya ba la sogs pas bshad pa 'di'i glus bskul ba zhes bya ba ste sngon gyi smon lam gyis nye bar slong bas rab tu sad pa ste /
analyzed: 'di zhes bya ba la sogs pas bshad pa 'di'i glus bskul ba zhes bya ba ste sngon gyi smon lam gyis nye bar slong bas rab tu sad pa ste /
translated: The verse beginning with encouraged by this song means that he is awakened by the urging of the former aspiration, and

original: he ru ka rang nyid ces bya ba ni sa bon gyi gzugs spangs nas mngon sum du he ru kar thig le bzhi'i rang bzhin rnams kyis snying rje la sogs pa'i gzugs can 'chad par 'gyur ba'i phyag dang gzugs la sogs pa dang lhan cig rab tu sad
analyzed: he ru ka rang nyid ces bya ba ni sa bon gyi gzugs spangs nas mngon sum du he ru kar thig le bzhi'i rang bzhin rnams kyis snying rje la sogs pa'i gzugs can 'chad par 'gyur ba'i phyag dang gzugs la sogs pa dang lhan cig rab tu sad
translated: he is Heruka himself means that he is awakened by the four circles, which are the nature of the four seed syllables, together with the hands, faces, and so on, which are the forms of compassion and so on.

original: pa ni gsal ba'i gzugs te 'bras bu'i rdo rje 'chang zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: pa ni gsal ba'i gzugs te 'bras bu'i rdo rje 'chang zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The form of clarity is the meaning of the resultant Vajradhara.

original: de ltar sngags kyi yi ge brjod pa'i bdag nyid can skad cig gis rnam pas bcom ldan 'das bzhengs pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar sngags kyi yi ge brjod pa'i bdag nyid can skad cig gis rnam pas bcom ldan 'das bzhengs pa'o //
translated: Thus, the BhagavƒÅn arises by the method of the instant, which is the nature of the expression of the mantra syllables.

original: de'i sngags gsungs pa /
analyzed: de'i sngags gsungs pa /
translated: The mantra is stated:

original: aom a'a:zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: aom a'a:zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Om ƒÅ·∏• h≈´·πÉ.

original: yi ge bcu gnyis rnams su phyi rol la sogs pa'i padma'i bar du 'khor lo rnams dang padma dang dpa' bo dpa' mo'i dbang phyug ma thams cad dang lhan cig tu skyes pa ste lhag ma rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi sgom pa rnams ni thams cad rtogs par
analyzed: yi ge bcu gnyis rnams su phyi rol la sogs pa'i padma'i bar du 'khor lo rnams dang padma dang dpa' bo dpa' mo'i dbang phyug ma thams cad dang lhan cig tu skyes pa ste lhag ma rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi sgom pa rnams ni thams cad rtogs par
translated: The twelve syllables are in the outer lotuses, etc., together with all the wheels, lotuses, and heroes and heroines. The rest of the yogis‚Äô meditations are all easy to understand.

original: sla'o // 'on kyang 'jig rten gyi khams kyi de'i rnam par gzhag pa bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: sla'o // 'on kyang 'jig rten gyi khams kyi de'i rnam par gzhag pa bshad par bya ste /
translated: However, the arrangement of the world realms should be explained.

original: 'dir sngon du gang tshangs pa la sogs pa'i lha rnams bdud rtsi'i dbus su bzhugs so //
analyzed: 'dir sngon du gang tshangs pa la sogs pa'i lha rnams bdud rtsi'i dbus su bzhugs so //
translated: Here, first, the gods such as BrahmƒÅ reside in the middle of the nectar.

original: de'i rang bzhin las de'i tshe 'dir ye shes kyi rnam pa tshangs pa la sogs pa'i lha rnams snying rje dang byams pa dang dga' pa dang btang snyoms kyi rang bzhin gyi bdag nyid rnams kyis 'dir zhugs pa las bslang ba'o //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin las de'i tshe 'dir ye shes kyi rnam pa tshangs pa la sogs pa'i lha rnams snying rje dang byams pa dang dga' pa dang btang snyoms kyi rang bzhin gyi bdag nyid rnams kyis 'dir zhugs pa las bslang ba'o //
translated: From their nature, at that time here, the forms of gnosis, the gods such as BrahmƒÅ, with the nature of compassion, love, joy, and equanimity, enter here and are aroused.

original: de rnams kyis yang sngon gyi mtshan nyid rjes su dran par byas nas lus kyi bdud rtsi za ba la zhen pas gang byas pa sngon gyi rnal 'byor bsgoms pa la sogs pa'i @138b las de thams cad rjes su dran par byas nas sad do //
analyzed: de rnams kyis yang sngon gyi mtshan nyid rjes su dran par byas nas lus kyi bdud rtsi za ba la zhen pas gang byas pa sngon gyi rnal 'byor bsgoms pa la sogs pa'i @138b las de thams cad rjes su dran par byas nas sad do //
translated: Having remembered the characteristics of the past, they are attached to eating the nectar of the body. Having remembered all those deeds, such as the practice of yoga in the past, they awaken.

original: mig gi dbang po la sogs pas thams cad mthong ngo //
analyzed: mig gi dbang po la sogs pas thams cad mthong ngo //
translated: With the sense organs of the eyes and so on, they see everything.

original: gang sngon gyi zla ba dang nyi ma bsrubs pas bdud rtsi bskyed do //
analyzed: gang sngon gyi zla ba dang nyi ma bsrubs pas bdud rtsi bskyed do //
translated: Whatever was churned in the past by the moon and sun generates nectar.

original: de rnams kyis yang rang gi lus bdud rtsi nyid kyi phyir zla ba dang nyi ma la sogs pa dang rgyu skar gyi 'khor lo mthong do //
analyzed: de rnams kyis yang rang gi lus bdud rtsi nyid kyi phyir zla ba dang nyi ma la sogs pa dang rgyu skar gyi 'khor lo mthong do //
translated: They also see the moon, sun, and so on, and the wheel of the lunar mansions because their own bodies are nectar.

original: de'i tshe bcu gnyis kyi bdag nyid kyi chos kyi 'khor lo sngags brjod pas ri rab la sogs pa dang nam mkha'i mtha' thams cad mthong ngo //
analyzed: de'i tshe bcu gnyis kyi bdag nyid kyi chos kyi 'khor lo sngags brjod pas ri rab la sogs pa dang nam mkha'i mtha' thams cad mthong ngo //
translated: At that time, by reciting the mantra of the twelve-part Dharma wheel, they see all of Meru and so on and the limits of space.

original: de las ngag skyes te des yang 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa thams cad kyi stan bcos byung ngo //
analyzed: de las ngag skyes te des yang 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa thams cad kyi stan bcos byung ngo //
translated: From that, speech was born, and by that, all the treatises of the world and beyond the world arose.

original: de ltar bstan bcos rjes su dran pa byas nas gang dang gang gis bram ze dang rgyal rigs la sogs pa ji ltar yang dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo'i rnal 'byor ma dang dpa' mo rnams kyi rigs rnams te /
analyzed: de ltar bstan bcos rjes su dran pa byas nas gang dang gang gis bram ze dang rgyal rigs la sogs pa ji ltar yang dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo'i rnal 'byor ma dang dpa' mo rnams kyi rigs rnams te /
translated: Thus, having remembered the treatises, whatever the caste of the brahmins, k·π£atriyas, and so on, they are the castes of the yoginƒ´s and heroes of the ma·πá·∏çala wheel.

original: der rigs kyi las rnams la gnas nas so //
analyzed: der rigs kyi las rnams la gnas nas so //
translated: There, having remained in the caste duties,

original: 'jigs byed dang dus mtshan sred pa dang sdang ba byung ba'o //
analyzed: 'jigs byed dang dus mtshan sred pa dang sdang ba byung ba'o //
translated: Bhairava, KƒÅlarƒÅtri, craving, and hatred arose.

original: des s'a lu la sogs pa'i lo tog gang du btab pas sa rnams kyi cha byung do //
analyzed: des s'a lu la sogs pa'i lo tog gang du btab pas sa rnams kyi cha byung do //
translated: By that, wherever crops such as rice were planted, the parts of the earth arose.

original: lte ba gcig ni bud med do //
analyzed: lte ba gcig ni bud med do //
translated: One navel is a woman.

original: nyi ma ni skyes pa'o //
analyzed: nyi ma ni skyes pa'o //
translated: The sun is a man.

original: me ni 'dod chags so //
analyzed: me ni 'dod chags so //
translated: Fire is passion.

original: gar ni gar gyi nyams dgu la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gar ni gar gyi nyams dgu la sogs pa ste /
translated: Dance is the nine moods of dance, and so on.

original: sna tshogs pa'i gar dang glu dang rol mo dang skad dang lung la sogs pa dang 'dod pa'i bstan bcos dang zhe sdang dang 'dod chags dang gti mug dang phrag dog la sogs pa dang khro ba dang 'thab pa dang gtam brjod pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid
analyzed: sna tshogs pa'i gar dang glu dang rol mo dang skad dang lung la sogs pa dang 'dod pa'i bstan bcos dang zhe sdang dang 'dod chags dang gti mug dang phrag dog la sogs pa dang khro ba dang 'thab pa dang gtam brjod pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid
translated: The various kinds of consciousness arise, such as those of dance, song, music, language, scripture, and so on, and of desire, hatred, lust, delusion, envy, and so on, and of anger, fighting, speaking, and so on,

original: dang bla ma la bsnyen bkur ba dang mchod pa byed pa la sogs pa dang / sbyin pa la sogs pa dang / zhi ba'i gzugs dang / dam pa'i chos kyi sems dang / zhi ba la sogs pa'i las kyi tshogs kyi sems dang de la sogs pa sna tshogs pa'i 'du shes rnams byung ngo //
analyzed: dang bla ma la bsnyen bkur ba dang mchod pa byed pa la sogs pa dang / sbyin pa la sogs pa dang / zhi ba'i gzugs dang / dam pa'i chos kyi sems dang / zhi ba la sogs pa'i las kyi tshogs kyi sems dang de la sogs pa sna tshogs pa'i 'du shes rnams byung ngo //
translated: and of serving and worshipping the guru and so on, and of generosity and so on, and of the mind of the Dharma of peace, and of the mind of the collection of actions of peace and so on, and of various kinds of perceptions.

original: lus ni nag po de bzhin du ljang gu phyed phyed can zhes bya ba ni mtshan mo dang nyin par gyi 'du shes so //
analyzed: lus ni nag po de bzhin du ljang gu phyed phyed can zhes bya ba ni mtshan mo dang nyin par gyi 'du shes so //
translated: The body is black, and likewise half-green, and so on, which is the perception of night and day.

original: phyag bdun cu rtsa drug rnams kyi zhes bya ba ni g-yon pas khams sum cu rtsa brgyad rnams 'byin pa ste /
analyzed: phyag bdun cu rtsa drug rnams kyi zhes bya ba ni g-yon pas khams sum cu rtsa brgyad rnams 'byin pa ste /
translated: The sixty-six hands are the thirty-eight constituents that are emitted by the left [hands].

original: de yang phung @139a * //
analyzed: de yang phung @139a * //
translated: The thirty-eight constituents are the five aggregates,

original: pho dang / khams dang / skye mched dang / yul dang / las kyi dbang po dang las kyi dbang po'i yul te /
analyzed: pho dang / khams dang / skye mched dang / yul dang / las kyi dbang po dang las kyi dbang po'i yul te /
translated: the twelve sense spheres, the eighteen elements, the ten action faculties, the five action faculties, and the five objects of the action faculties.

original: de ltar drug drug pas sum cu rtsa drug ste khu ba dang khrag gnyis so //
analyzed: de ltar drug drug pas sum cu rtsa drug ste khu ba dang khrag gnyis so //
translated: Thus, there are thirty-six by six each, plus the two, semen and blood.

original: 'di rnams g-yas par sdud pa ste zung gi tshig tu gnas so //
analyzed: 'di rnams g-yas par sdud pa ste zung gi tshig tu gnas so //
translated: These are gathered into the right [hands], and thus they are in pairs.üîΩSimilarly, the faces are seventeen.

original: de bzhin du zhal rnams ni bcu bdun zhes bya ba ni sngon du bshad pa rnams kyis 'di ni gsang ba zhes bya ba la sogs pas khams bcu drug rnams te bcu bdun pa ni rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du zhal rnams ni bcu bdun zhes bya ba ni sngon du bshad pa rnams kyis 'di ni gsang ba zhes bya ba la sogs pas khams bcu drug rnams te bcu bdun pa ni rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: The sixteen constituents are as previously explained. The seventeenth is consciousness.

original: ral pa'i cod pa na 'dzin zhes bya ba ni sna tshogs pa'i 'jig rten sgrin du re ba rnams 'khor lo can du bya ba'i phyir dang dam pa'i chos la gzhag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ral pa'i cod pa na 'dzin zhes bya ba ni sna tshogs pa'i 'jig rten sgrin du re ba rnams 'khor lo can du bya ba'i phyir dang dam pa'i chos la gzhag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Holding a crest jewel means that in order to make those who hope for various worldly benefits into wheel-holders and in order to establish them in the sublime Dharma.

original: dpa' bo zhes bya ba ni sna tshogs pa'i dra rnams kyis sngon gyi nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa la sogs pa skyes pa rnams kyi g-yul ngo las rgyal ba nyid kyis so //
analyzed: dpa' bo zhes bya ba ni sna tshogs pa'i dra rnams kyis sngon gyi nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa la sogs pa skyes pa rnams kyi g-yul ngo las rgyal ba nyid kyis so //
translated: The hero is so called because of the victory over the battle of the various afflictions, secondary afflictions, etc. that have arisen in the past.

original: sna chos rdo rje zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas dang chos dang dge 'dun dang bla ma dang rnal 'byor ma rnams la dad pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: sna chos rdo rje zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas dang chos dang dge 'dun dang bla ma dang rnal 'byor ma rnams la dad pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The nose-vajra is so called because of faith in the Buddha, Dharma, and Sa·πÖgha, the guru, and the yoginƒ´s.

original: zla ba phyed pa can zhes bya ba ni ro mchog myang ba dang khu ba'i thigs pa zhu ba nyid kyis so //üîΩmche ba chen po gtsigs pa'i zhal //
analyzed: zla ba phyed pa can zhes bya ba ni ro mchog myang ba dang khu ba'i thigs pa zhu ba nyid kyis so // mche ba chen po gtsigs pa'i zhal //
translated: The half-moon is so called because of the experience of the supreme taste and the melting of the drop of semen.

original: zhes bya ba ni sdang ba rnams tshar gcod pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sdang ba rnams tshar gcod pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The face with bared fangs is so called because of the destruction of the hateful.

original: zhal rnams ser ba dang ljang gu dang dmar po dang po dang nag po'i kha dog gis dus bzhi dang bzhi dang thun mtshams bzhi dang dus tshod bzhi'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhal rnams ser ba dang ljang gu dang dmar po dang po dang nag po'i kha dog gis dus bzhi dang bzhi dang thun mtshams bzhi dang dus tshod bzhi'i phyir ro //
translated: The faces are yellow, green, red, white, and black for the four times, the four junctures, and the four periods.

original: de ltar yang mtshon cha'i tshogs rnams g-yas dang g-yon pa na zhes bya ba ni ji lta ba'i rim pas glang po che'i pags pas 'khor ba'i chos rnams kyi 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar yang mtshon cha'i tshogs rnams g-yas dang g-yon pa na zhes bya ba ni ji lta ba'i rim pas glang po che'i pags pas 'khor ba'i chos rnams kyi 'jug pa'o //
translated: Thus, the weapons in the right and left hands are the engagement of the phenomena of cyclic existence, in the order of the elephant hide.

original: skye gnas kyi phyag rgyas ni mya ngan las 'das pa la 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: skye gnas kyi phyag rgyas ni mya ngan las 'das pa la 'jug pa'o //
translated: The mudra of the womb is the engagement of nirvana.

original: lhag ma phyag bdun cu rtsa gnyis kyi mtshon cha rnams kyi dang de bzhin du mgo bo ldas brgyan pa dang phyag rgya drug gis dang mgo bo brgya'i phreng bas dang dpung rgyun gyis dang / zhabs gdub kyis dang de'i sgras dang stag gi pags pas dang ba spu 'khyil pa yis te de ltar brgyad cu rnams kyis sems kyi spyod pa stong phrag brgyad cu rnams byung ba'o //
analyzed: lhag ma phyag bdun cu rtsa gnyis kyi mtshon cha rnams kyi dang de bzhin du mgo bo ldas brgyan pa dang phyag rgya drug gis dang mgo bo brgya'i phreng bas dang dpung rgyun gyis dang / zhabs gdub kyis dang de'i sgras dang stag gi pags pas dang ba spu 'khyil pa yis te de ltar brgyad cu rnams kyis sems kyi spyod pa stong phrag brgyad cu rnams byung ba'o //
translated: The remaining seventy-two weapons of the hands, the adornment of the ten heads, the six mudras, the garland of one hundred heads, the armlets, the anklets, the sound of those, the tiger skin, and the curl of hair between the eyebrows‚Äîthese eighty are the arising of the eighty thousand mental behaviors.

original: de ltar spyan lnga bcu rtsa gcig rnams kyis aom @139b gyi yi ge la sogs pa nas ka'i yi ge'i mthar dbyangs dang gsal byed kyi yi ge rnams kyi 'du shes so //
analyzed: de ltar spyan lnga bcu rtsa gcig rnams kyis aom @139b gyi yi ge la sogs pa nas ka'i yi ge'i mthar dbyangs dang gsal byed kyi yi ge rnams kyi 'du shes so //
translated: Thus, with the eleven eyes, one should understand the letters of the vowels and consonants from the letter O·πÉ up to the letter Ka.

original: de ltar de'i mdun du zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du rdo rje phag mo'i bsgoms pa la mkhas pas sna tshogs pa'i gnas su dpa' bo dang dpa' mo'i dbang phyug ma rnams ma rnams bskyed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar de'i mdun du zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du rdo rje phag mo'i bsgoms pa la mkhas pas sna tshogs pa'i gnas su dpa' bo dang dpa' mo'i dbang phyug ma rnams ma rnams bskyed par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, in front of him, etc., up to one should meditate. By being skilled in the meditation of VajravƒÅrƒÅhƒ´, the heroines will be generated in various places.

original: dar gyi phreng ba ni dpa' mo'i dbang phyug ma rnams la ste des sna tshogs pa'i sa'i dum bu rnams su chos la sogs pa yang dag par srung pa'i don du stobs kyi 'khor los sgyur ba la sogs pa sna tshogs pa'i rgyal po byung do //
analyzed: dar gyi phreng ba ni dpa' mo'i dbang phyug ma rnams la ste des sna tshogs pa'i sa'i dum bu rnams su chos la sogs pa yang dag par srung pa'i don du stobs kyi 'khor los sgyur ba la sogs pa sna tshogs pa'i rgyal po byung do //
translated: The silk garlands are for the heroines, and by that, in various parts of the earth, the various kings such as Balacakravartins will arise for the sake of perfectly protecting the Dharma, etc.

original: brtul zhugs zhes bya ba ni sngon gyi rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis byas pa'i las kyi phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: brtul zhugs zhes bya ba ni sngon gyi rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis byas pa'i las kyi phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The term observance means for the sake of the deeds performed by the former yogis.

original: de ltar rgyu'i rdo rje 'chang bsgom pa ni bsnyen pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar rgyu'i rdo rje 'chang bsgom pa ni bsnyen pa'o //
translated: Thus, the meditation on the causal Vajradhara is the approach.

original: de zhu bar gyur pa ni nye ba'i bsnyen pa'o //
analyzed: de zhu bar gyur pa ni nye ba'i bsnyen pa'o //
translated: The melting of that is the close approach.

original: 'bras bu rdo rje 'chang du rdzogs pa ni sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu rdo rje 'chang du rdzogs pa ni sgrub pa'o //
translated: The perfection as the resultant Vajradhara is the accomplishment.

original: de nas rdo rje phag mo bsgom pa'i rnal 'byor ni sgrub pa chen po zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de nas rdo rje phag mo bsgom pa'i rnal 'byor ni sgrub pa chen po zhes bya ste /
translated: Then, the yoga of meditating on Vajravarahi is called the great accomplishment.

original: mthar gnas dang bdag dang rnal 'byor bsrung ba la sogs pas dang po sbyor ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin lus kyi rang bzhin can no //
analyzed: mthar gnas dang bdag dang rnal 'byor bsrung ba la sogs pas dang po sbyor ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin lus kyi rang bzhin can no //
translated: The samadhi called the first yoga, which has the nature of the body, is by means of the final abiding, the self, the protection of the yoga, and so forth.

original: da ni dkyil 'khor rgyal po mchog ces bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gsungs pa /
analyzed: da ni dkyil 'khor rgyal po mchog ces bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gsungs pa /
translated: Now, the samadhi called the supreme king of mandalas is stated:

original: padma zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: padma zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The lotus, etc.

original: 'dir dang po'i sbyor bas 'jig rten gyi khams 'byung ba dang rgyal po rdzogs pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: 'dir dang po'i sbyor bas 'jig rten gyi khams 'byung ba dang rgyal po rdzogs pa'i bar du'o //
translated: Here, by the first yoga, the arising of the world realms up to the completion of the king is stated.

original: de nas dkyil 'khor rgyal po mchog tu gnas pa'i dus te /
analyzed: de nas dkyil 'khor rgyal po mchog tu gnas pa'i dus te /
translated: Then, the time of abiding in the supreme king of mandalas.

original: gang gi tshe sngon gyi rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis shes rab dang thabs dag gis dang he ru ka dang rdo rje phag mo dag gis rang gi rig pa'i tshogs pa'i he ru ka'i gzugs rnams dang / rnal 'byor ma rnams spro zhing sdud pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe sngon gyi rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis shes rab dang thabs dag gis dang he ru ka dang rdo rje phag mo dag gis rang gi rig pa'i tshogs pa'i he ru ka'i gzugs rnams dang / rnal 'byor ma rnams spro zhing sdud pa'o //
translated: When the previous yogins, by means of wisdom and means, and Heruka and VajravƒÅrƒÅhƒ´, emanate and gather the assemblies of their own awareness in the form of Herukas and yoginƒ´s,

original: de bzhin du ri rab la sogs pa dang sa gzhi rnams gnas pa yod pas lha la sogs pa'i 'jig rten rnams dang rang rang gi gnas rnams kyi nges pas padma'i 'dab ma la sogs pa 'khor lo thams cad kyi dpa' bo dang rnal 'byor ma sangs rgyas
analyzed: de bzhin du ri rab la sogs pa dang sa gzhi rnams gnas pa yod pas lha la sogs pa'i 'jig rten rnams dang rang rang gi gnas rnams kyi nges pas padma'i 'dab ma la sogs pa 'khor lo thams cad kyi dpa' bo dang rnal 'byor ma sangs rgyas
translated: and likewise, since the mountains, such as Meru, and the ground exist, the worlds of gods, etc., and their individual abodes, such as lotus petals, are the wheels of all the heroes and yoginƒ´s, the buddhas

original: kyi rigs kyi 'jig rten rol pa ste rgyun chad pa med pa'i rgyud kyis @140a * //
analyzed: kyi rigs kyi 'jig rten rol pa ste rgyun chad pa med pa'i rgyud kyis @140a * //
translated: sporting in the world of the buddha family, the tantra of uninterrupted continuity.

original: spro ba ste re re'i mtha' med pa'i rigs zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: spro ba ste re re'i mtha' med pa'i rigs zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Emanation means that each one is endless, meaning ‚Äúfamily.‚Äù

original: de ltar shar la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni mkha' 'gro lnga'i rigs las byung ba snga ste /
analyzed: de ltar shar la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni mkha' 'gro lnga'i rigs las byung ba snga ste /
translated: Thus, east and so on means that the directions are born from the five dakinis.

original: de ltar / mkha' 'gro ma dang gzugs can ma //
analyzed: de ltar / mkha' 'gro ma dang gzugs can ma //
translated: Thus, the dakini, the embodied,

original: 'od byed ma dang mdog nag ma //
analyzed: 'od byed ma dang mdog nag ma //
translated: the radiant, the dark-hued,

original: yongs gyur ma dang byis bcas ma //
analyzed: yongs gyur ma dang byis bcas ma //
translated: the transformed, the childish,

original: rjes su mdog ma kha dog sngo ba ste shar la sogs pa nas byang gi mthar sa gzhi'i rjes su rigs pa'i kha dog go //
analyzed: rjes su mdog ma kha dog sngo ba ste shar la sogs pa nas byang gi mthar sa gzhi'i rjes su rigs pa'i kha dog go //
translated: the subsequent, and the blue-hued are the colors of the directions from east to north, respectively.

original: de las byung ba'i dngos po rnams kyis za ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de las byung ba'i dngos po rnams kyis za ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The things that arise from them are the objects of consumption and so on.

original: de ltar l'a ma la sogs pa yang shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar l'a ma la sogs pa yang shes par bya'o //
translated: Thus, one should understand the directions of LƒÅma and so on.üîΩThe left is the left side of the body, and the right is the right side of the body.üîΩ The right is the right side of the body, and the left is the left side of the body.

original: g-yon skor du zhes bya ba ni ji ltar me long du gdong la sogs pa'i gzugs brnyan g-yon pa'i lus po ni g-yas par so sor gsal te g-yas pa'i lus po g-yon par kyang do //
analyzed: g-yon skor du zhes bya ba ni ji ltar me long du gdong la sogs pa'i gzugs brnyan g-yon pa'i lus po ni g-yas par so sor gsal te g-yas pa'i lus po g-yon par kyang do //
translated: The front is the front of the body, and the back is the back of the body.üîΩ The above is the crown of the head, and the below is the soles of the feet.üîΩ The east is the face, and the west is the back of the head.üîΩ The south is the right side of the body, and the north is the left side of the body.

original: de'i tshe rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi dkyil 'khor rnams su he ru ka la sogs pa dang rnal 'byor ma'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi dkyil 'khor rnams su he ru ka la sogs pa dang rnal 'byor ma'o //
translated: The nadir is the secret place, and the zenith is the crown of the head.üîΩ The northeast is the right ear, and the northwest is the left ear.üîΩ The southeast is the right eye, and the southwest is the left eye.üîΩ The southwest is the right nostril, and the northeast is the left nostril.üîΩ The northwest is the right shoulder, and the southeast is the left shoulder.üîΩ The east is the right hand, and the west is the left hand.üîΩ The south is the right foot, and the north is the left foot.üîΩ The nadir is the anus, and the zenith is the crown of the head.üîΩ The northeast is the right knee, and the northwest is the left knee.üîΩ The southeast is the right elbow, and the southwest is the left elbow.üîΩ The east is the right thigh, and the west is the

original: des kyang g-yas pa'i lag pa rnams su g-yon pa'i mchod pa'o //
analyzed: des kyang g-yas pa'i lag pa rnams su g-yon pa'i mchod pa'o //
translated: By that, the left-hand offerings are in the right hands.

original: de bzhin du lag pa g-yon pa rnams su g-yas pa'i mchod pas zhes bya ba ni gdams pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du lag pa g-yon pa rnams su g-yas pa'i mchod pas zhes bya ba ni gdams pa'o //
translated: Similarly, the right-hand offerings are in the left hands.

original: de rnams kyis kyang ri rab gling thams cad kyi g-yon par so sor gsal te nyi ma'i lag pa'i 'od zer gyis kyang ste g-yon du shar nas g-yas su 'gro'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyis kyang ri rab gling thams cad kyi g-yon par so sor gsal te nyi ma'i lag pa'i 'od zer gyis kyang ste g-yon du shar nas g-yas su 'gro'o //
translated: They also shine in all the continents of Mount Meru, individually, with the light rays of the hand of the sun, rising in the left and moving to the right.

original: de'i grib ma'i lag pa g-yas su shar nas g-yon du 'gro'o //
analyzed: de'i grib ma'i lag pa g-yas su shar nas g-yon du 'gro'o //
translated: The shadow of that hand rises in the right and moves to the left.

original: de ltar yang bdud rtsi lnga'i snod las sngon gyi rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi nyi shu rtsa bzhi'i gnas dang nye ba'i gnas kyi gnas rnams su thig le 'brul lo //
analyzed: de ltar yang bdud rtsi lnga'i snod las sngon gyi rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi nyi shu rtsa bzhi'i gnas dang nye ba'i gnas kyi gnas rnams su thig le 'brul lo //
translated: Thus, from the vessel of the five nectars, the bindu trickles into the twenty-four sacred sites and sub-sites of the previous yoginƒ´s.

original: de rnams kyis kyang dpa' bo dang rnal 'byor ma thams cad kyis bstar bar bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de rnams kyis kyang dpa' bo dang rnal 'byor ma thams cad kyis bstar bar bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: They also become the offerings of all the heroes and yoginƒ´s.

original: des yang lha rnams kyi nye bar longs spyod par 'gyur ro /
analyzed: des yang lha rnams kyi nye bar longs spyod par 'gyur ro /
translated: By that, they also enjoy the offerings of the gods.

original: g-yas brkyang zhes bya ba ni slar yang byang chub kyi lam rnams su rab tu 'jug par 'dod do //
analyzed: g-yas brkyang zhes bya ba ni slar yang byang chub kyi lam rnams su rab tu 'jug par 'dod do //
translated: The right leg extended is the desire to enter again into the paths of enlightenment.

original: thod pa'i phred ba sogs 'dzin ma //üîΩzhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: thod pa'i phred ba sogs 'dzin ma // zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Holding a garland of skulls, etc.,

original: sna tshogs pa'i sngags kyi bzlas pa rnams la dga' ba'o //
analyzed: sna tshogs pa'i sngags kyi bzlas pa rnams la dga' ba'o //
translated: is the delight in the various mantra recitations.

original: phyag dang mtshon cha dag ni lta ba drug la sogs par 'jug par yang do //
analyzed: phyag dang mtshon cha dag ni lta ba drug la sogs par 'jug par yang do //
translated: The hands and weapons are the entry into the six views, etc.

original: de byis pa'i sngags pa bsgrib par bya ba'i phyir phag mo ji ltar gcig tu na sangs rgyas ba'i ye @140b shes 'chad pa 'ba' zhig ma yin zhes bya ste 'di ni thig le'i 'khor lo'o //
analyzed: de byis pa'i sngags pa bsgrib par bya ba'i phyir phag mo ji ltar gcig tu na sangs rgyas ba'i ye @140b shes 'chad pa 'ba' zhig ma yin zhes bya ste 'di ni thig le'i 'khor lo'o //
translated: In order to conceal the childish mantra practitioners, why is it not only the explanation of the wisdom of the Buddhas? is the circle of bindus.

original: da ni 'khor lo'i ra ba'i 'khor lo gsungs pa /
analyzed: da ni 'khor lo'i ra ba'i 'khor lo gsungs pa /
translated: Now, the wheel of the enclosure of the wheel is stated:

original: de'i phyi rol du zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste thog mar ye shes kyi sku'i rnam par gzhag par brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de'i phyi rol du zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste thog mar ye shes kyi sku'i rnam par gzhag par brjod par bya ste /
translated: Outside of that, etc. First, the arrangement of the wisdom body should be stated:

original: 'khor lo de'i bdag nyid rnams su yang do //
analyzed: 'khor lo de'i bdag nyid rnams su yang do //
translated: The wheel of the enclosure of the wheel is the entry into the wheel of the enclosure of the wheel.

original: de yang thog mar rdo rje'i 'khor lo zhes bya ba ni mi phyed pa'i gzugs nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang thog mar rdo rje'i 'khor lo zhes bya ba ni mi phyed pa'i gzugs nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Further, the vajra wheel is so called because it is the form of indivisibility.

original: 'khor lo'i rab gnas pa thams cad kyi yang dngos po thams cad dbyer med pa'i sems te phan tshun dag 'dod chags la sogs pa med do //
analyzed: 'khor lo'i rab gnas pa thams cad kyi yang dngos po thams cad dbyer med pa'i sems te phan tshun dag 'dod chags la sogs pa med do //
translated: The wheel is the consecration of all things, and the mind of indivisibility of all things is the mutual absence of desire, etc.

original: de nying de ltar bla na med pa'i rigs te 'di rnams thams cad kyi bla na med pa nyid kyi phyir dang mthar thug pa zhes bya ba ste nges pa'o //
analyzed: de nying de ltar bla na med pa'i rigs te 'di rnams thams cad kyi bla na med pa nyid kyi phyir dang mthar thug pa zhes bya ba ste nges pa'o //
translated: That is the supreme lineage, because it is the supremacy of all these, and it is called ultimate, that is, certain.

original: de ltar sa gzhi sngo dang gnag pa'i dbus su zhes bya ba ni ra rib kyi grib mas kyang ste sems dang sems las byung pa la sogs pa rnams kyis gnyis su med pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar sa gzhi sngo dang gnag pa'i dbus su zhes bya ba ni ra rib kyi grib mas kyang ste sems dang sems las byung pa la sogs pa rnams kyis gnyis su med pa'o //
translated: Thus, in the center of the blue and black ground is the shade of the blue lotus, and the non-duality of mind, mental factors, etc.

original: des kyang de rnams kyi de'i mdog go //
analyzed: des kyang de rnams kyi de'i mdog go //
translated: That is their color.

original: de ltar mkha' 'go ma la sogs pa nas 'bar chen mo zhes bya ba'i bar rnams kyis rnal 'byor ma su ma cu rtsa drug rnams dang de'i rigs can rnams de'i rang bzhin rnams kyis 'khor lo'i ra bar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar mkha' 'go ma la sogs pa nas 'bar chen mo zhes bya ba'i bar rnams kyis rnal 'byor ma su ma cu rtsa drug rnams dang de'i rigs can rnams de'i rang bzhin rnams kyis 'khor lo'i ra bar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Thus, from the beginning of the chapter up to the Great Blazing, the sixty-four yoginis, and those of their type, are of their nature in the enclosure of the wheel.

original: de ltar phyag bzhi zhes bya ba ni rlung dang med dang chu dang nam mkha'i bdag nyid can gyi bdud rtsi zos pas rags pa nyid de sa med do //
analyzed: de ltar phyag bzhi zhes bya ba ni rlung dang med dang chu dang nam mkha'i bdag nyid can gyi bdud rtsi zos pas rags pa nyid de sa med do //
translated: Thus, the four-armed one, by eating the nectar of the nature of wind, fire, water, and space, is free from grossness, i.e., earth.

original: de ltar thod pa bdud rtsi'i snod dang khat'm ga rang dang gzhan gyi cha'i rdzas yongs gzung pa med de ser sna med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar thod pa bdud rtsi'i snod dang khat'm ga rang dang gzhan gyi cha'i rdzas yongs gzung pa med de ser sna med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Thus, the skull is the vessel of nectar, and the khatvanga is the substance of one's own and others' parts, which is not grasped, because of non-avarice.

original: d'a ma ru zhes bya ba ni sgra dang sgra'i lan gyis 'du shes tsam kyang med pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: d'a ma ru zhes bya ba ni sgra dang sgra'i lan gyis 'du shes tsam kyang med pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The damaru is the mere idea of sound and sound's echo, which is without sound.

original: gri gug de bzhin zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa'i bag chags thams cad dang bral bas so //
analyzed: gri gug de bzhin zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa'i bag chags thams cad dang bral bas so //
translated: The flaying knife is likewise, because of being free from all the instincts of the afflictions such as desire.

original: skra grol ba zhes bya ba ni bdag dang bdag gi ba'i gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dor ba'o //
analyzed: skra grol ba zhes bya ba ni bdag dang bdag gi ba'i gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dor ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúHair loose‚Äù means to cast off the duality of self and other.

original: phyogs gos 'chang zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' la 'gro bar 'dod pa'o ;
analyzed: phyogs gos 'chang zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' la 'gro bar 'dod pa'o ;
translated: ‚ÄúWearing a corner garment‚Äù means to desire to go into space.

original: / phyag rgya lnga zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa lngas byin gyis brlabs pa'i lus su gnas pa'o //
analyzed: / phyag rgya lnga zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa lngas byin gyis brlabs pa'i lus su gnas pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúFive symbolic ornaments‚Äù means to abide in a body blessed by the five transcendent lords.

original: rdo rje'i phreng ba zhes bya ba ni sna tshogs pa'i bla ma'i gdams dag sngon gyi bag chags rjes su dran pas brgyan pa'o //üîΩyi dgas gdan zhes bya ba ni rang gi sems kyi chos kyi @141a * //
analyzed: rdo rje'i phreng ba zhes bya ba ni sna tshogs pa'i bla ma'i gdams dag sngon gyi bag chags rjes su dran pas brgyan pa'o // yi dgas gdan zhes bya ba ni rang gi sems kyi chos kyi @141a * //
translated: ‚ÄúVajra garland‚Äù means to be adorned by the recollection of the various instructions of the guru and the instincts of the past.

original: dbyings kyi rang bzhin la'o //
analyzed: dbyings kyi rang bzhin la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúSeat of a ghost‚Äù means in the nature of the realm of reality of one‚Äôs own mind.

original: drag chen mo zhes bya ba ni rang gi lta ba la mngon par dga' ba'o //
analyzed: drag chen mo zhes bya ba ni rang gi lta ba la mngon par dga' ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúGreat fierce one‚Äù means to delight in one‚Äôs own view.

original: de ltar 'khor lo thams cad kyi rnal 'byor ma rnams kyis nges par de ltar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar 'khor lo thams cad kyi rnal 'byor ma rnams kyis nges par de ltar rig par bya'o //
translated: Thus, all the yoginƒ´s of the ma·πá·∏çala should know it in this way.

original: sna tshogs pa'i rgyan dang ldan zhes bya ba ni sna tshogs pa'i yon tan rnams kyis rnam par brgyan ba'o //
analyzed: sna tshogs pa'i rgyan dang ldan zhes bya ba ni sna tshogs pa'i yon tan rnams kyis rnam par brgyan ba'o //
translated: Endowed with various ornaments means adorned with various good qualities.

original: shes rab thabs dang ldan pa mo //
analyzed: shes rab thabs dang ldan pa mo //
translated: Possessing wisdom and means

original: zhes bya ba ni 'chad par 'gyur bas kyang bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'chad par 'gyur bas kyang bshad par bya'o //
translated: will be explained by what is to be explained.

original: de ltar 'di la sogs pas gzugs med khams zhes bya ba ni gzugs med pa'i khams rnams kyi rigs zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de ltar 'di la sogs pas gzugs med khams zhes bya ba ni gzugs med pa'i khams rnams kyi rigs zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Thus, this and so on is called the formless realm. The meaning of the term formless realm is the type of the formless realms.

original: gnas de yang zhes bya ba ni ri rab  kyi kun nas phyogs dang mtshams dang logs su gnas pa nyis kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: gnas de yang zhes bya ba ni ri rab  kyi kun nas phyogs dang mtshams dang logs su gnas pa nyis kyi phyir ro //
translated: That place means the place in the cardinal and intermediate directions and on the sides of Mount Sumeru.

original: rab tu dga' ba'i sa zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin par rnam par bshad pa de rab tu dga' ba'i sems kyis rab tu phrad pa las thun mong gi sa ste de nyid de ltar phung pho lhag ma med pa'i don sna tshogs ba
analyzed: rab tu dga' ba'i sa zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin par rnam par bshad pa de rab tu dga' ba'i sems kyis rab tu phrad pa las thun mong gi sa ste de nyid de ltar phung pho lhag ma med pa'i don sna tshogs ba
translated: The stage of joy is the stage of joy due to the mind of joy in the explanation of the perfection of generosity. It is a common stage. That very stage is the meaning of the various aggregates without remainder.

original: sgrub pa'i bsam gtan dang po nyid kyi phyir byang chub chen po'i sa'o //
analyzed: sgrub pa'i bsam gtan dang po nyid kyi phyir byang chub chen po'i sa'o //
translated: It is the stage of great enlightenment because it is the first meditative concentration of practice.

original: 'dis gnas 'di rnams thams cad kyi sna tshogs pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams rnams su sangs rgyas kyi chos 'jug pa bshad de 'di ni nges pa'o //üîΩdes gnas dad nye ba'i gnas la sogs pa slar zhes bya ba ni gnas 'di rnams thams cad 'chang par 'gyur ba'i rim bas gnas dang nye ba'i gnas dang zhing dang nye ba'i zhing dang 'dun sa dang nye ba'i 'dun sa dang 'du ba dang nye ba'i 'du
analyzed: 'dis gnas 'di rnams thams cad kyi sna tshogs pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams rnams su sangs rgyas kyi chos 'jug pa bshad de 'di ni nges pa'o // des gnas dad nye ba'i gnas la sogs pa slar zhes bya ba ni gnas 'di rnams thams cad 'chang par 'gyur ba'i rim bas gnas dang nye ba'i gnas dang zhing dang nye ba'i zhing dang 'dun sa dang nye ba'i 'dun sa dang 'du ba dang nye ba'i 'du
translated: This explains the entry of the Buddha qualities into all the various world-realms of these stages. This is the certainty.

original: ba dang dur khrod dang nye ba'i dur khrod dang pi la ba dang nye ba'i pi la ba rnams su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ba dang dur khrod dang nye ba'i dur khrod dang pi la ba dang nye ba'i pi la ba rnams su 'gyur ro //
translated: The return of the stages, the neighboring stages, etc., is as follows: these stages become the stages, the neighboring stages, the fields, the neighboring fields, the assemblies, the neighboring assemblies, the charnel grounds, the neighboring charnel grounds, the Pƒ´luva, and the neighboring Pƒ´luva, in the order of their retention.

original: gcig ces bya ba la sogs pas de de bzhin du bshad do //
analyzed: gcig ces bya ba la sogs pas de de bzhin du bshad do //
translated: One, etc., explains that as it is.

original: thams cad la zhes bya ba ni dngos po thams cad kyi khams gcig pa ste mig la sogs pa thams cad do //
analyzed: thams cad la zhes bya ba ni dngos po thams cad kyi khams gcig pa ste mig la sogs pa thams cad do //
translated: All means the single realm of all things, all eyes, etc.

original: sum cu rtsa drug khams rjes su rim pas zhes bya ba ni yang dag par bshad pa sum cu rtsa drug la sum cu rtsa drug rnams kyis bsgyur bas de la stong nyis brgya dgu bcu rtsa drug tu 'gyur te gtso bo yon tan kun rang bzhin zhes
analyzed: sum cu rtsa drug khams rjes su rim pas zhes bya ba ni yang dag par bshad pa sum cu rtsa drug la sum cu rtsa drug rnams kyis bsgyur bas de la stong nyis brgya dgu bcu rtsa drug tu 'gyur te gtso bo yon tan kun rang bzhin zhes
translated: The thirty-six elements are the thirty-six that are correctly explained.üîΩSince they are multiplied by thirty-six, there are one thousand two hundred ninety-six.üîΩ

original: bya ba'i gzhung gis so //üîΩde ltar 'di rtsa'i yi ges lams rnams rnal 'byor ma rnams kyi rang bzhin can zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: bya ba'i gzhung gis so // de ltar 'di rtsa'i yi ges lams rnams rnal 'byor ma rnams kyi rang bzhin can zhes bya ba ste /
translated: ‚ÄúThe thirty-six elements in sequence‚Äù means that the thirty-six are multiplied by thirty-six, making one thousand two hundred and ninety-six, as stated in the text ‚Äúthe nature of all the qualities of the primary principle.üîΩ‚ÄùüîΩThus, these channels are the nature of the yoginƒ´s.

original: lnga ba'i don du dang po ste rnal 'byor ma rnams kyi khams so //
analyzed: lnga ba'i don du dang po ste rnal 'byor ma rnams kyi khams so //
translated: The meaning of the fifth [letter] is the first [letter], which is the element of the yoginƒ´s.

original: rang bzhin can las @141b dpa' bo rnams kyi khams zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin can las @141b dpa' bo rnams kyi khams zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The nature of the yoginƒ´s is the element of the heroes.

original: nges 'khor lo'i rva pha rnams su de de bzhin du bshad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nges 'khor lo'i rva pha rnams su de de bzhin du bshad par 'gyur ro //
translated: This will be explained in the same way in the spokes of the wheels.

original: de slar yang sum cu rtsa drug dbye ba zhes bya ba ni de ltar 'khor lo'i ra ba la sogs pa'i gnas rnams su gling bcu gnyis rnams su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de slar yang sum cu rtsa drug dbye ba zhes bya ba ni de ltar 'khor lo'i ra ba la sogs pa'i gnas rnams su gling bcu gnyis rnams su 'gyur ro //
translated: ‚ÄúAgain, the division into thirty-six‚Äù means that in this way, in the places of the wheel‚Äôs spokes, and so on, there are twelve islands.

original: der gnas de rnams su yang gnas dang nye ba'i gnas la sogs pa rnam par dag pas sum cu rtsa drug gi rigs rnams su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: der gnas de rnams su yang gnas dang nye ba'i gnas la sogs pa rnam par dag pas sum cu rtsa drug gi rigs rnams su 'gyur ro //
translated: In those places, in the pure places and neighboring places, there are thirty-six types.

original: yul dang yul rim pas phye'o zhes bya ba'i tshig gis so //
analyzed: yul dang yul rim pas phye'o zhes bya ba'i tshig gis so //
translated: By the words ‚Äúthe countries and the countries are divided in order,‚Äù

original: de ltar rdo rje'i 'khor lo rnams su gri gug gis bskor bar gnas pa zhes bya ba ste ye shes kyi pha rol tu son pa zhes bya ba'i nges pa ste 'khor lo'i ra ba rnams su'o //
analyzed: de ltar rdo rje'i 'khor lo rnams su gri gug gis bskor bar gnas pa zhes bya ba ste ye shes kyi pha rol tu son pa zhes bya ba'i nges pa ste 'khor lo'i ra ba rnams su'o //
translated: thus, in the vajra circles, the places are surrounded by the curved knives. This is the certainty called ‚Äúthe perfection of wisdom.‚Äù In the circles of the walls,

original: de ltar yang ma gsungs kyang bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar yang ma gsungs kyang bshad par bya ste /
translated: although it is not said in that way, it should be explained.

original: rdo rje phag mo'i 'khor lo rnams de nas dbus kyi bdag nyid du lte ba'i padma rnams su yi ge nyid shu rtsa bzhis phag mo'i sngags rnams su lhag ma'i yi ge rnams rnal 'byor ma rnams kyi bskyed ba ste /
analyzed: rdo rje phag mo'i 'khor lo rnams de nas dbus kyi bdag nyid du lte ba'i padma rnams su yi ge nyid shu rtsa bzhis phag mo'i sngags rnams su lhag ma'i yi ge rnams rnal 'byor ma rnams kyi bskyed ba ste /
translated: In the circles of VajravƒÅrƒÅhƒ´, in the center of the navel cakra, the twenty-four letters are the mantras of VƒÅrƒÅhƒ´. The remaining letters are the yoginƒ´s.

original: le'u gnyis par bshad pas so //
analyzed: le'u gnyis par bshad pas so //
translated: This is explained in chapter 2.

original: de bzhin du 'di nyid du bshad de go cha'i sngags kyi yi ge rnams dang dpa' bo dang dpa' mo'i dbang phyug ma rnams dang rnal 'byor ma bcu gnyis rnams kyi ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'di nyid du bshad de go cha'i sngags kyi yi ge rnams dang dpa' bo dang dpa' mo'i dbang phyug ma rnams dang rnal 'byor ma bcu gnyis rnams kyi ste /
translated: Likewise, it is explained here that the letters of the armor mantra, the heroines, the twelve yoginis,

analyzed: de ltar sum cu rtsa drug pa khor yug 'dzin gyi ri'i 'khor lo zhes bya'o //
translated: and the thirty-six, called the wheel of the mountain range that holds the periphery, are the wheel of the mind.

original: de la gnas pa rnams kyi lha drang srod rnams kyi rigs zhes bya ba ni nges pa'o //
analyzed: de la gnas pa rnams kyi lha drang srod rnams kyi rigs zhes bya ba ni nges pa'o //
translated: The lineage of the gods there is the determination.

original: da ni thugs kyi 'khor lo bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni thugs kyi 'khor lo bshad par bya ste /
translated: Now the wheel of the mind is to be explained.

original: de nas de'i phyi rol du zhes bya ba la sogs pas zla ba'i gling gi rnam par gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: de nas de'i phyi rol du zhes bya ba la sogs pas zla ba'i gling gi rnam par gzhag pa'o //
translated: Then, outside of that, etc.

original: thugs zhes bya ba ni zla ba'i gling rnams su gnas pa'i sems can rnams kyi snying bskyed pa rnams kyi snying gi yon tan du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thugs zhes bya ba ni zla ba'i gling rnams su gnas pa'i sems can rnams kyi snying bskyed pa rnams kyi snying gi yon tan du 'gyur ro //
translated: The mind is the mental qualities of the beings who dwell in the lunar regions.

original: zla ba'i thig le nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: zla ba'i thig le nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because of the lunar drops.

original: dmar dang ser ba zhes bya ba ni rang gis rig pa gnyis su med pa'i phyir kha dog ces bya ba grub po //
analyzed: dmar dang ser ba zhes bya ba ni rang gis rig pa gnyis su med pa'i phyir kha dog ces bya ba grub po //
translated: The red and yellow are established as colors because of the non-duality of the self-awareness.

original: de ltar de'i 'khor lo'i rtsibs kyi dbus su gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar de'i 'khor lo'i rtsibs kyi dbus su gnas pa'o //
translated: Thus, it is located in the center of the spokes of that wheel.

original: yul dang yul du'o //
analyzed: yul dang yul du'o //
translated: In the directions and sub-directions.

original: de ltar 'dir rnal 'byor ma rnams gsungs pa /
analyzed: de ltar 'dir rnal 'byor ma rnams gsungs pa /
translated: Thus, the yoginis are mentioned here:

original: rdo rje 'chang ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas gnod mdzes rgyal po zhes bya ba'i bar du rigs sum cu rtsa drug gi rigs can ma rnams so //
analyzed: rdo rje 'chang ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas gnod mdzes rgyal po zhes bya ba'i bar du rigs sum cu rtsa drug gi rigs can ma rnams so //
translated: Vajradhara, etc., up to Sumbharaja, are the yoginis of the thirty-six families.

original: de ltar kha dog @142a * //
analyzed: de ltar kha dog @142a * //
translated: Thus, the color, etc.,

original: ces bya ba la sogs pa nas thog mar de'i de zhes bya ba'i bar du rtogs par sla'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pa nas thog mar de'i de zhes bya ba'i bar du rtogs par sla'o //
translated: up to at the beginning, that of his is easy to understand.

original: 'on kyang gling rnams su gad rnam par gzhag pa de thams cad lung gi nang du rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang gling rnams su gad rnam par gzhag pa de thams cad lung gi nang du rtogs par bya'o //
translated: However, the arrangement of the continents should be understood from the scriptures.

original: gtso bo zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'khor los sgyur ba bcu gnyis rnams kyi ming gsungs pa /
analyzed: gtso bo zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'khor los sgyur ba bcu gnyis rnams kyi ming gsungs pa /
translated: The names of the twelve cakravartins are mentioned by the principal, etc.

original: 'di rnams thams cad kyis yang 'khor los sgyur ba he ru ka chen po zhes bya'o //

translated: From death, the cattle, that is, all the aggregates and so forth, are eaten, and everything is accomplished, that is, the great seal and all the words, and everything dissolves there.

original: kun nas kun du son pa las //
